summary_comment: Professor Knodel is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and genuine care for student learning. She provides ample opportunities for students to correct their mistakes and offers extra credit, retakes, and test corrections, fostering a supportive learning environment. Her engaging approach and thorough course layout ensure that students grasp complex material, making the class both accessible and challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Knodel is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and genuine care for student learning. She provides numerous opportunities for students to correct mistakes and excel, making the class both engaging and manageable despite its complexity.

Ratings.comment: If you want an A, you can get one. Professor Knodel cares if you learn the material and gives you opportunities to correct your mistakes.

Dr. Knodel is the goat! Extra credit, retakes for quizzes, test corrections. Makes it feel like you can actually learn the latin as opposed to hitting a checklist for a grade like in some other classes. Genuinely cares about her work + the students involved

This class was fairly easy, but not because there was no work. For covering so much, it was remarkably well laid out. Prof. Knodel is very engaging and does her best to make sure everyone understands the content. It's not graded harshly, but you have to put in the legwork to really grasp the material (probably goes for any intro language class).

Dr. Knodel was an amazing professor. She did an amazing job teaching a complicated subject. She ensures that students are all learning the information and is willing to work with you if something is going awry.

summary_comment: Professor Brown is highly regarded for his dedication and care towards his students, often going above and beyond to support their learning. His Modern Greek courses are challenging yet rewarding, requiring significant effort but leading to substantial gains in language proficiency. Students appreciate his genuine concern for their understanding and personal growth, though some find his teaching style disorganized and his assessments demanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brown is highly regarded for his dedication and care towards his students, though his classes demand significant effort and engagement. Students consistently praise his genuine interest in their learning and development, though they note that his teaching style can be demanding and disorganized at times.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Brown is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He puts in so much time for his students and deeply cares about everyone that comes into his classroom. His class isn't an easy A and you have to put in the work to understand the language, but overall Professor Brown is an amazing man.

If you genuinely want to learn to speak Greek well, Dr. Brown's Modern Greek courses are a great choice. However, if you're just taking the class for credit or aren't serious about mastering Greek, these courses may not be for you. They require hard work, but Dr. Brown is one of the most genuine and caring instructors you'll meet.

I went into his class with a solid knowledge of the subject matter and prior experience with the readings, and he blew me out of the water at first. You get to class, and he just talks and talks, then expects you to take notes on his rambles. Then will give a very specific quiz. It was difficult and particular and the class I learned the most from.

the professor was really chill. we readings for every class and pop quizzes for most of them. however, i actually dont know if it went towards my grade. i actually dont know how i got graded in the class. i dont have a single grade in carmen but got an A.
Cares about students more than any professor I've had at OSU

Not much Greek is spoken in class. Its all memorization and random calling on students to answer, without really confirming that you understand. He also makes it clear that he only teaches academic level Greek and talks badly about Greeks that use slang or a lower form of the language. I would not recommend

Prof. Brown was a great professer. I truly learned a lot of Greek in his class and would 100% have him as a teacher again. He was really easy and gave many quizzes on material we covered in class the day before. He reviews the quiz material before the quiz to ensure everyone passes. A great man, and loves his students.

I have Professor Brown for his Greek language classes and let me tell you, never before have I seen Professor develop such a great working relationship with his entire class. Very much so in tune with the needs of the class as well as the Greek culture. While the class is often disorganized, you can feel yourself learning a ton.

lectures were insanely disorganized; i wrote a few key points down&sometimes paid attention but passed with an A! He has readings for you to complete before each class (all online, no textbook req.) and i almost never read any of it (just check main topic). He gives you the questions for the midtermfinal as a study guide&answers them in class!

this class was DEFINITELY not an easy GE. Although i did get an A, the amount of work for this 3cr hr class was unbelieveable. Pop quizzes over insanely long readings, and a giant 10page research paper. There were also exams, which involved around 9+ essay responses.... The content was very interesting, but was a lot of time. He was a little creepy

EXTREMELY disorganized class. No structure to lectures. Lots of readinglong Greek movies. Long essay exams, however he graded them easily. 10 page paper due at the end of the semester. Attendance required, quizzes about the reading at the beginning of every class. Overall, I would not recommend this class.

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Sports and Spectacles in the Ancient World

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Sports and Spectacles in the Ancient World

summary_comment: Professor Hawkins is highly regarded for his passion and engaging lectures, which make learning Greek mythology enjoyable and interesting. However, his quizzes are known to be challenging, focusing on minute details with limited attempts, which some students find stressful and time-consuming. Despite the rigorous testing, he is described as a genuinely caring and accessible professor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hawkins is highly regarded for his passion and engaging lectures, which make the subject matter enjoyable and interesting. However, his classes are challenging, particularly due to the detailed and often difficult weekly quizzes that can significantly impact grades.

Ratings.comment: Ugh I love him. He's so passionate about the subject and his lectures are super entertaining. There are weekly quizzes, two midterms and a final, but they are all online. He is super nice and easy to reach through email.

Passionate, caring guy with cool modern connections to Greek myths. Beware of quizzes: they're open-note but VERY specific with Few questions (you only have one attempt at each). The emphasis on details detracts from learning the big takeaways. Lectures not required but slides aren't comprehensive (his riffs are fun anyways)! Take thorough notes.

This was my favorite class of the semester. You can tell Professor Hawkins really cares, and he is extremely knowledgable about his information. I found his lectures very interesting but it is important to pay attention because the only graded material in this class are 10 quizzes. The quizzes are difficult if you do not understand the material.

Professor Hawkins is a passionate guy about mythology and the lecture he teaches. The weekly quizzes are open noted but are a little difficult. Outside of class, he is a genuine guy and care about the students. Really good class and many takeaways!

His lectures are very engaging and interesting when it comes to the content. The problem is the weekly quizzes. The quizzes will have the most specific details for the questions, and they're only 10 pts so missing one question is detrimental. I should not have a higher grade in Gen Chem 1 than I do in this class especially since this is a GE class.

Mr. Hawkins is super entertaining and makes learning about greek mythology fun and easy to understand. Weekly multiple choice online quizzes that aren't too bad. The only issue I have is sometimes the quiz questions are wrong or vague, but other than that probably one of my favorite classes

Quizzes had the most absurd answers down to the most minute details. Slides and lectures did not help, and quizzes would take over an hour to find all the tiny details. Only had 1 attempt at quizzes as well, while other professors taking the same class gave unlimited attempts. Should not be like this for a GE that is supposed to bring grade up.

He's a genuinely good guy who's passionate about what he teaches. His exams, however, are very tough and ask questions on the most minute little details. You think you're prepared and then it asks a question about something you've never even heard of in class. Tests cover a TON of material. Be ready to study more than you have for any GE class.

Cool guy. I was in the first semester where you didn't have to write a single paper. Your whole grade was 1 quiz per week (online), one midterm (online), and one final (online). I went to 2 classes and worked in a study group with my friends and passed with flying colors. Great guy though, so try to go to his lecture. He loves what he does.

This class was very enjoyable. Had assigned readings each week and lecture was review of the readings. Had weekly quizzes that were untimed, midterm, and final that were all online. Attendance isnt mandatory but I found it very helpful as sometimes the myth readings can be a little confusing. Overall easy & interesting class. Tons of extra credit!

100% of lecture was a waste of time. The readings were long and hard; there is plenty of supplemental material on websites like spark notes. He absolutely never lectured to what was on the tests or quizzes. This class IS easy if you can do 40 pages a week, however, the prof is unnecessary. You are on your own which is not a bad thing.

Class is really easy and enjoyable. Quizzes had unlimited attempts to get a 100 and have 3 essays that were 2 pages double spaced. The lecture is more of a discussion of the reading. Dont expect real notes. Have to read the assigned myths. Everything online.

Easy honors GE, decent amount of reading but you can definitely skim or sparknote. No tests, quizzes on the myths and discussions, 3 projects that you get to pick from a list of 6-7. Hawkins is an engaging, interesting guy  but class dragged on just because there isn't a ton to discuss with the subject matter.

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Classical Receptions: Ancient Greece and Rome in the Modern World

summary_comment: Professor Green is a knowledgeable lecturer who provides thorough feedback on papers but is generally standoffish and lacks engagement outside of class. The class workload is primarily centered around two exams and one paper, with grading being less frequent and sometimes delayed. Despite these challenges, some students find his expertise valuable and are willing to take the class again due to his dedication to providing detailed feedback.
summary_comment_short: Professor Green is a knowledgeable lecturer who provides thorough feedback on papers but is generally standoffish and lacks engagement outside of class. He assigns minimal graded work and occasionally leaves grades unposted for extended periods.

Ratings.comment: A very, very standoffish professor. His welcome video was basically him saying how he doesn't get paid enough and how even though one of the 6 quizzes will be dropped, "you WILL do all six". Beyond that, nice dude. Gave good feedback on analysis and other papers. Doesn't grade super heavy.

Papers are extremely difficult to write based on the lack of instructions that he gives. This professor is lazy and will not put any grades in for months at a time so you never really know what your grade is. The only reason I would take this class again is because he is so lazy that he sometimes just puts 100's in for everyone.
Great teacher overall. The class consists of two exams and one paper.

Dr. Green knows his stuff and is a solid lecturer. If you ask for feedback on your paper, he will go above and beyond. Before you take Ancient Roman Classics, just know that it is a lot of reading classics and not a lot of learning about culture.

summary_comment: Professor Fletcher is widely criticized for his teaching methods, with students finding his lectures repetitive and difficult to follow, often focusing on the same reading material. Many also report issues with unclear communication, frequent changes to due dates, and a lack of consistent feedback. While some appreciate his humor and willingness to discuss mythology and philosophy, the overall consensus is that his teaching style hinders rather than enhances learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fletcher is widely criticized for his teaching methods, with students finding his lectures repetitive and difficult to follow, often centered around the same reading material. Many also report issues with unclear communication, frequent changes to due dates, and a lack of responsiveness to emails, leading to a generally negative teaching experience.

Ratings.comment: This professor needs to teach a different class, preferably one where he knows what he's teaching and doesn't just talk about the same reading over and over. Been in class over a month and each assignment has had to do with the same reading. I'm learning nothing and philosophy is getting ruined.

By far one of the worst professors I have had the displeasure of having. He rambles and cannot communicate information or ideas clearly, he is not an artist nor is he a philosopher, he is violently incompetent at digital communication, and he answers questions with questions. He never replies to emails and randomly changes due dates.

Dr. Fletcher was a very tedious and long lecturer. He typically went much too in depth and philosophical in the myths, and was too difficult to follow. The quizzes aren't that easy, and you have to go to lecture to pass them. He can be quite funny at times, but the time in class is better spent actually doing the readings.

He made mythology pretty interesting. Going to lecture several times a week got old very quickly though, because of my lack of interest in the subject matter. If you go to lectures you get information for the last 3 questions on his weekly 10-question quiz. In order to pass all you have to do is know the stories somewhat well and write a few papers

Worst professor ever, the quizzes were really a lot harder than with other professors. His accent is annoying. 0-10 do not recommend. you literally have to go to every class or you will miss 3 questions on every quiz

Okay so let's start with the fact that Prof Fletcher is a hilarious British man, so showing up to lectures is great just to hear him talk. He is super helpful if you have questions, and he loves to just talk about mythology and philosophy; which I found entertaining. Easy A, just pay attention and read. Helps that I think he's kinda cute lol.

This class is pretty decent if you need a literature GE. That being said, the lectures are interesting, but kind of hard to understand. Prof. Fletcher kind of gets philosophical about myths and I don't ever really know what he is talking about. If you skim the reading and attend the lecture you will be more than fine.

Dr. Fletcher expects you to make this GE course the center of your priorities and punishes the class for a lack of attendance (even though it isn't required) by not posting the lecture slides.  He moves too quick through everything and is difficult to understand.
Good professor but the lectures weren't the most interesting but a lot of material from the quizzes you'd only know if you attended. Read and attend most lectures and you'll do fine.
The topics became really uninteresting as the semester went, but as long as you did well on the online quizzes you got a high grade. Lots of reading!! But on the bright side, no final!

Not always the most interesting material but he made the lectures more interesting and there was material on the quizzes you could only get from going to lecture. Make sure you read the books. I recommend him!
Loves to lecture. Just show up and the class is easy.

Most of the material was review for me, but Fletcher made it interesting, and the grading system is easy if you remember to take the quizzes each week. Quizzes were online this semester, which meant that you could just google the answers if you didn't know them. Lectures weren't mandatory, but he had certain slides that you only get at lecture

I think Fletcher is on to something with is class model / structure. It's certainly not perfect, but it is interest. Personally, the lectures were incredibly boring, i could not help but fall asleep, i'm not sure if it was his accent, or speaking but i couldnt listen/ comprehend what he said. Quizzes were easy IF you read, papers not bad.

Great teacher and he was very funny! Attendance isn't mandatory for lecture but it is for recitation.  No Midterm or final, just weekly 10 point quizes and 3 papers. Very easy class and interesting for the most part. Easy A class if you take the time to read the material.

The grade for this class consisted of three papers and weekly recitation quizzes. Even though you could probably get by with not going to class, Prof. Fletcher was hilarious (and I loved hi British accent). I would definitely recommend this professor.

Interesting class. Huge lecture so only recitation attendance was mandatory. Quizzes are easy points as long as you read (which usually isn't bad) and pay attention when he gives answers in class. Towards end of semester there were lots of bonus opportunities. He has a good sense of humor. Content can be really interesting. Overall great class.

This is the class to take if you need either a Literature or Global Studies GE. 13 quizzes (one dropped), three slightly difficult papers, and attendance credit. He also gives an extra credit quiz at the end. He gave the content, what I thought was hard to hunderstand, clarity and meaning. Take the class!

Weekly quizzes are pretty easy and they are a good opportunity for points. Had to do a lot of reading, but there aren't any midterms. Okay way to get your GE credit. Oh, and his sexy British accent is pretty awesome.

Richard is awesome! He is very helpful and gives detailed power points. He is obviously extremely knowledgable about mythology. He has an accent which makes the class all the more fun. Richard also seems to genuinely care about teaching and his students. TAKE HIS CLASS
His lectures werent the most interesting, but theres no midterm or final so that made up for that

While I took 222, it is now 2220. His accent makes class enjoyable, it is interesting, too. Go to class though, the info is quizzable and not on Carmen. There were ten 5 pt quizzes (lowest dropped). There were three papers, worth 5, 10 & 15 pts. Class was out of 100, with recitation mandatory & worth 25 pts. Easy 5 pt ex cred paper. Awesome class

This is a great class,especially if you like mythology. Fletcher is super friendly, doesn't lecture on fridays, and gives no midterm or final. And he has a British accent so he's fun to listen to. Assignments include nightly reading, weekly multiple choice quizzes and 3 papers. Great class, I enjoyed it a lot.
Great Lecturer.  Keeps the content interesting and the class easy.

Enthusiastic, knowledgeable lecturer. Weekly quizzes, three papers. Tends to run over, don't schedule anything immediately afterward. If you go to lecture, you should be able to answer all the quiz questions. He also gives a lot of clues on what he wants to see in the papers at lecture. Reading not overly burdensome, but sometimes dull, Plato esp.

I personally love mythology so I loved this class, however in lectures he runs overtime everyday and can ramble a lot. However the quizzes are easy, there are no midterms or final and only three papers to write. Interesting class only if you like mythology. Also lots of reading each night to do.

Five papers, but you can email them to him ahead of time and he'll tell you exactly what to fix before grading. A lot of the grade is participation, so show up (even though it sometimes feels like forever) and talk once in a while. Great guy!

Painfully knowledgable about his subject, so lectures can be either really boring or informative, depending on your level of interest. However, the 4 papers and the project were straightforward and were not graded harshly at all. You would pretty much have to try not to do well in this class. Very friendly and extremely helpful. Highly recommended.

PP slides that he puts up on Carmen, 4 3pg papers, one 7pg final paper, no quizzes. He essentially tells you what he wants to see in each paper, so there is no excuse to not get an A in this class. Lectures go extremely slow, however.

Dr Fletcher is a really brilliant man, but he can't communicate clearly and often goes much more in depth than is required. Lecture is not helpful, but he gets offended if you don't go. Do the readings and show up for lecture with something else to keep you occupied.

Classics222.Attendance required.10 quizzes, drop lowest 1.3 papers (he says is new this quarter).No midterms/finals.If you already have ANY knowledge of mythology, you'll do fine. If you have time, read the lecture PPTs; they help! Take Fletcher for recitation b/c he gives you nearly all the answers to the quiz during discussions (he writes them!).

he is a good teacher. he makes the class a lot harder than some other teachers. he has a lot of reading, and the myth class stuff is kinda is a pain. if i had to do it again i would take one of the other teachers. all and all he isnt bad and really cares about the subject, maybe a little too much.
good teacher who uses powerpoint slides and wants his students to succeed would take again

english accent is the best. he loves classics but lectures go really fast. my t.a. made this class easier, but there is a ton of reading involved if your t.a. is crappy.(justin hanson is good) take this class with someone because every lecture has a "myth flash" which is not in the online slides, but is on the weekly quiz.
Fletcher is pretty good, he posts his slides which help out a lot.  There is a lot of reading involved, not too bad of a class.  Easy to get an A if you put in the time.
One of the best teachers I've had.
He knows his stuff, adapts well to the students, but his lectures are sometimes quite boring
No Comments

The notes make things easy to study for, and he gives you enough choice on the tests that you should be able to do well. He really knows his stuff, and he's great to talk to after class. A bit disheveled and disorganized, Fletcher seems like the absent-minded professor cliche. Quizzes do require you to do the reading, but the readings aren't bad.

SEI.Subject: ARTEDUC
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on Topical Issues in Art Education.

SEI.Subject: ARTEDUC
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on Topical Issues in Art Education.

SEI.Subject: ARTEDUC
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on Topical Issues in Art Education

SEI.Subject: ARTEDUC
SEI.Class Name: Visual Culture: Investigating Diversity & Social Justice

SEI.Subject: ARTEDUC
SEI.Class Name: Visual Culture: Investigating Diversity & Social Justice

summary_comment: Professor Carolina Lopez-Ruiz is known for her comprehensive knowledge of the subject matter and a considerate approach to teaching, though some students found her explanations challenging at times. Her courses are generally considered easy, with a focus on participation and simple assessments, making them a good choice for GPA improvement. However, the teaching style varies among students, with some finding her lectures engaging and others preferring the material covered in class over her explanations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Carolina Lopez-Ruiz is known for her comprehensive knowledge of the subject matter and a considerate approach to teaching, though some students found her lectures challenging to follow due to tangents and difficulty in conveying complex ideas. Her courses are generally easy to pass with minimal effort, featuring simple quizzes, easy essay topics, and optional finals, making them a good choice for GPA boosts.

Ratings.comment: I went to the mandatory amount of lectures and passed this course with 100%. Going to the lectures was nice, when I did, because she truly is passionate.

The class was interesting. She sometimes struggled to get her point across and rambled here and there but overall she was very kind and the information was usually interesting. The class is not hard in the slightest. Just show up to the lectures and listen and you'll be just fine. She also posts the lectures so if you miss you can go back and watch

Professor Carolina Lopez-Ruiz is a considerate instructor, but she may have trouble explaining her ideas to audiences, especially in this course that have many weir terms. However, she is working hard to improve this and every students can feel it. Nicely organized course and should be your choice if you having trouble deciding which GE to choose.

Great GPA booster. Two attempts on weekly quizzes. Weekly participation is one simple question. Three quick essays. Final exam is optional. She wrote the textbook and definitely knows her stuff so if you're interested in the material you will learn from her as well.

The class is very easy. You only need to participate 12 times and you can say goodbye to lectures. The weekly quizzes are very simple and you can look at the slides to find the information quickly. The 3 papers we had to write were easy topics and they do not grade them heavily at all.

Super easy course. Grade is based off of participation points (which you can earn during class or outside of it,) ten point quizzes (which you get two attempts on, and they're open note,) and three short essays. Definitely a GPA booster with only a small amount of effort.

I personally was not a big fan of Carolina. Although the class just wasn't my taste, her lectures were a huge snooze fest and I rarely felt inspired to participate. There was always readings to be done, and hard work never paid off. This class will have you doubting if you're going to pass or not. I wouldn't say she's horrible, but she'snot for me.

Great class. While there is a required textbook, just showing up to class covers everything you need to know for the quizzes. Papers are short, not challenging, and fun. No final exam if you do well on the open note quizzes. Attendance is not mandatory, but it is definitely worth it to attend and participate.
Just use the powerpoints that she uses to take little bit of notes. It will help you with the online quizzes. 2 relatively easy paper.
Look at the online powerpoints and take the online quizzes and you will pass.

She was great seriously and so were her TAs she is one of the nicest professors you will ever meet. I still learned a lot from her and shes so enthusiastic about what she teaches. Her book was actually really good which I wasnt expecting going in. Go to class, do the readings, and write a fun but good essay and youll be fine.

super easy A. If you're looking for a grade booster - here's your class. You definitely don't have to go to class but if you are really interested in the subject she's very passionate about it and it's pretty interesting. You don't need the book but it really helped to have it when writing the essays (2 short, easy essays - I got 100s on both)

One of the easiest classes I have ever taken. You can put a lot of work into the class and really dive into the mythology and how it is connected. (She literally wrote the textbook the class uses.) Or, you can not show up to class, and take the online, open note quizzes using the lecture slides she posts and still get an A.

In high school, I took combined English/World Civilizations classes and had to read mythology every day. We read most of the texts that we are reading in this class but I actually enjoy it this time around. She is such a great professor and takes a more well-rounded approach to classics. Take her! She's very knowledgeable and enthusiastic to teach!

literally showed up the first day and not once again and got a 99.5% in the class. No exams ever. 5 pt online quiz every week and no final if you average above A- and you get two attempts on the quiz. Highly recommended grade booster easy professor but her accent is very thick so couldnt understand her when she used a microphone anyways

hardly showed up to class, and still passed (with an A!) read the powerpoints online, and you'll pass the class easy. not great if you're actually hoping to learn about greek mythology, great if you dont care about your GEs.

One quizz per week. There are 14 quizzes and she will drop 2 (lowest ones). She is funny on her own way. Very caring when it comes to assisting students. There's also 2 short essays. You get to re-submit the 1st one. All quizzes are online and there are 2 attempts. Final (Online) is optional if your average is over 90%. Def fun and interesting.

This class was pretty straightforward. There were weekly quizzes that went along with the lecture notes. She was passionate about the material and understanding as a professor. The class was decently interesting even for someone who isn't a huge fan of mythology.

Very easy A. Attendance is not mandatory nor suggested; she talks very quietly and it can be very difficult to hear and understand her. Simply review the PowerPoints she posts online before the online quizzes and you should be good to go!

There are no exams in this class at all.  Just weekly quizzes which consist of questions pulled directly from the powerpoints on Carmen and 6 one page essays which are super easy.  I didn't go to class after the 1st month or even do the reading and got an A.  Just read the powerpoints before the quizzes (only takes 10 minutes to read through them).

Easy stuff. Show up to class and just listen. She also gives you power points. There are weekly quizzes on Carmen and 6 short 1 page essays. You get to drop 2 quiz grades and 1 essay. Only thing is there was a lot more near eastern myth than I was expecting because she specializes in comparative mythology.

summary_comment: Professor Lopez-Ruiz is passionate about her subject but can be challenging to follow due to her abstract teaching style. Despite this, she is described as very kind and easy to grade, with the majority of the assessment being through simple quizzes and short essays. While the class is considered easy and a good way to boost your GPA, some students found the material dry and unengaging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lopez-Ruiz is known for being passionate and caring, but her teaching style can be abstract and challenging to follow, leading to mixed reviews on learning effectiveness. Students find the class relatively easy, particularly due to frequent quizzes that can be passed with high scores, and two manageable essays.

Ratings.comment: She's passionate but hard to understand sometimes. She explains things in a very abstract way but is also a very easy teacher. Super nice and kind but I didn't learn much. Graded by 14 quizzes which are really easy and three papers also graded easily.
Easy class, passionate professor, makes the material more engaging.

I took this class because I needed to fulfill a requirement and I have the most useless advisor known to man (I actually go to a different advisor now). The class I took is CLAS 2301. DO NOT TAKE 2301. You have 60+ pages a week of a dry reading and Lopez-ruiz is just awful. GE's should be like this ... never take 2301.

I would recommend you take this class with some friends because it will be 10x easier. There's a weekly quiz, and if you pass them with a 90% you don't have to take the final. Also had 2 essays that weren't bad at all, that's the only reason you need the book really. Super easy GE, I definitely recommend.

Class is "QUIZ HEAVY". As long as you get over 90% on all the quizzes you don't have to take the final. Easy GPA booster, just make sure you make a friend in the class so you guys can take the quizzes together and get an A. You get 2 tries on each quiz but they're extremely specific, so go through the power points and her book.

I showed up for the first couple of weeks and never went back. There are weekly quizzes on the reading that are easy as long as you read the slides beforehand. The only time i used the book was for the 2 short essays. She drops the 2 lowest quiz grades, and if your average on the quizzes is 90% or above, you don't have to take the final. EASY A!!!

CLAS2220 under Lopez-Ruis is the easiest GE I've ever taken. I showed up for lecture for the first two weeks, before deciding to never show up again. I ended the class with a 99.3%. If you're looking for an easy literature GE, you can't do better, but unfortunately I don't think the class is good for those interested in the actual material.

She is a really great professor and cares a lot about what she teaches. Her accent can be difficult to understand, but you get used to it after a while. The exams are all easy if you look over the study guides she gives you. There's also one group project and 2 short essays. The attendance policy is annoying but this class is an easy A.

Pretty easy GE literature A. I only went to class the first two weeks. Two papers, weekly quizzes and optional final if you get an A/A- on the quizzes. She says the book is required, I only suggest renting it for the two papers if you don't plan on going to class.

The best GE choice Ive ever made. She tells you the textbook is mandatory but no one in my class ever bought it and we had no problems. Only two SHORT papers, no midterm, and optional final. Weekly quizzes but theyre online so you dont even have to do the reading, just pull up her lecture slides. If youre looking for an easy a this is it

There are three exams with no final and the exams are not cumulative. There is one presentation that no one pays attention to and she gives everyone an A. She will give out extra credit and she makes study guides.
Her three exams are not cumulative and she is a super easy grader. There is no final.

You can definitely tell she is from spain. Her accent is sometimes hard to understand and also there are often spelling errors in her power points. Although I as originally interested in mythology before taking the class, because the texts were original it was a little hard to understand and became BORING. But the class is so easy. No EXAMS!!

I found her difficult to understand but the quizzes were all online and she posts the slides from class so it's is easy to do well on them. 5 one page papers that are also easy. You don't have to go to lecture to get an easy A

Her lectures were kind of difficult to understand because of her accent, but once you get used to it she is a fantastic teacher. She genuinely cares for her students, gives relatively easy grades if you put in a little effort, and has interesting lectures. I learned a lot in her class. I would take the honors version though, it's a more close feel.

12 online quizzes and 5 one page papers is your grade. You don't have to show up for lecture but if mythology peaks your interests you might enjoy it, she is a world-class scholar. Three quizzes and one paper are dropped so its not hard to do well.

Really sweet lady; clearly enthusiastic about the material. However, read straight off the PowerPoints, so I didn't bother going to class most of the time. Most of the quiz answers are right on the PowerPoints. Would recommend.
Very interesting class and an easy A. Would definitely recommend this class and teacher.

The worse easiest class. The material was so easy. never read one story and still got an A-. The worse part about the class was her and her TAs! The TAs graded one page essays like they were english professors and left rude feedback for the paper. She didnt want to be bothered with emails from students because she said thats what the TAs were for!!

Really a very sweet and kind hearted professor. And she is very very attractive. Ok ok! she is down right sexy!!! I said it!!! She is super smart, super hot and Spanish!!! What more could you ask for?

Stopped going to class 2 weeks into the semester and still got an A. The quizzes are online and if you skim through power points and the book occasionally, its not difficult to get 1010. The weekly quizzes and 6 one page papers are your whole grade - and two quizzes and one paper gets dropped. Would DEFINITELY recommend taking for an easy gen ed.

Really hard to understand, and makes the class really dry and boring. It's in a giant lecture hall, and no one really cares, so can't understand much anyways. If there's another choice for Classical Myth, take him/her.

Professor Lopez-Ruiz is extremely knowledgeable. If you do the readings and attend the lectures, you will do great in this class. It is very important to read the book for this course otherwise the weekly quizzes will be very difficult due to the number of myths covered. Don't be discouraged if the first couple of weeks' stories are rough.

She was unhelpful and she grades papers very strictly. I'm pretty confident with my English grammar and I sailed through ENG1110 but apparently she found so many faults in my essay and gave me really low grades for my papers. I had a terrible experience with her. Also, her lectures use clickers so there's no "free" attendance points.But, she's hot.

I never attended class, and still got an A. It is in a big lecture hall and nobody cared. Honestly, I don't find the material interesting but if you read her powerpoints from carmen you can EASILY get an A.
Has a strong accent but the class is easy. She knows that mythology is an interesting topic and makes the class fun

She has a strong accent but she tries. I havent picked up the book yet and im getting an A. Interesting stuff, when you can focus. Its easy to zone out in her lectures. Go anyway, the quizzes are basically things underlined in powerpoints. SHe puts everything on Carmen. NO MIDTERMS OR FINAL !

Super easy A. You don't need to read or even attend lecture, spark notes and her weekly study guides are enough. Two simple essays and quizzes straight from the study guides. She's a little hard to understand but really nice and understanding. Interesting material to learn about too. Definitely recommend.

Pretty much all of her quiz's are on the study guide if you get them offline fill them out and review you will get an A you can probally just fill them out by going to lecture and a little wikipedia/cliff notes actions easy but fair A
great teacher, flat out awesome. Take her if you have the chance she is great and youll learn alot.

Pretty easy teacher..dont really need to buy texts..just read spark notes and do the quiz study guides she posts on carmen..take the study guide to lecture and fill it in as you go. I studied the night before for quizes and got an 88 on the final..A- in the class overall. She'skinda hard to understand at first but the more you go the better it gets

Lecture is absolutely useless. It is almost impossible to understand more than 2-3 consecutive words when she speaks in a large lecture setting.  And her slides are virtually useless to help with studying. Other than that her class is very easy as long as you keep up with the readings and do your study guides that she provides, its an easy A.

She is great!  Her lectures at first may be a little hard to understand because she has an accent, but you get used to it.  She always keeps the class interesting and has humor sometimes. Very nice and basically gives out answers during lectures.

The class was very interesting and all of the readings were fun. The class discussions were very helpful and it is all you needed to succeed in the class. I would highly recommend taking this class with Carolina as she makes mythology easy and fun (plus easy A).
Easy class. Very nice professor, always willing to help. Didn't use the book much, notes were enough to get an a in the class. If you can get a class with her, do it! Easy A and enjoyable!

Easy class. Professor Lopez-Ruiz is very nice and willing to help. Quizzes and exams are easy if you just take notes. Books aren't used a lot, you could get through the class easily without them, but that won't guarantee an A. Take her if you get the chance!

do not buy books for this class. get outlines from Carmen and take notes in class and its an easy A. She might be a little hard to understand but you get used to her accent quit and its really an easy class.

Ms. Lopez Ruiz was really easy.  If you go on carmen and write the outline of your notes before class and attend class and fill in the notes, its an easy A. People say that if you read you will do good, well i bought the books and did not read at all and got an A. Dont waste your money. Just attend class and take notes and its an easy A.
Really easy. Go to class for answers to her weekly study guides which in turn are the quizzes and the midterms. Weekly quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 final. No other grades. Easy A
She is very hard to understand because of her thick accent.  But the class is fairly easy.  If you read you'll get an A.

Has a sweet spanish accent. teaches well, just have to get used to the accent though. goes over everything and revisits similarities between different texts and therefore is a great teacher in that regard. really liked her!

summary_comment: Professor Lipp is highly regarded for his energetic and engaging teaching style, which significantly exceeds expectations compared to other professors. Students appreciate his accessible approach, cost-friendly textbooks, and straightforward grading system focused on quizzes and short papers. While some find his classes less academically rigorous and more focused on practical application, the majority praise his ability to make history relevant and interesting.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lipp is highly regarded for his energetic and engaging teaching style, which students find both enjoyable and effective. His classes are known for their accessible grading systems and interesting content, though some students note they can be less challenging and more focused on practical application rather than deep historical analysis.

Ratings.comment: (MU, NJ) Nothing but good words for Professor Lipp. He's got great energy and in terms of teaching, puts forth more effort for his students than most of my previous professors combined. His books are cost-friendly, and be prepared to use them. I honestly imagine you could only do poorly in Lipp's class if you simply refuse to interact with others.

Professor Lipp is a very nice person however as a Professor his class just wasn't challenging, and it didn't feel like a history class. A lot of people appreciate his approach but I can't get behind it, I prefer my history classes to talk about history. He solely grades on attendance, so beware if you are lazy like me.

Best 8:30 class ever. No better way to start an early morning class than with this wonderful man's outlook and optimism on the world. Was actually kind of sad that the class ended. I would love to see this man on the Joe Rogan podcast or at least get a drink with him sometime. This guy was like a Jedi Master. (Taken at Monmouth University, NJ)

Dr. Lipp has been my favorite professor at OSU by far. He makes his lectures interesting and funny. Papers are only one page and he offers to read it before you turn it in and give feedback so you're guaranteed an A. As long as you pay attention in lectures you'll get 100% on all the online quizzes. I would recommend his class to everyone!
His lectures are amazing! I havent read any of the books and still did well in his class. Definitely my favorite prof at osu.

Took this class to complete a GE but soon found out that this class was much more than that. Dr. Lipp cares a lot about this subject and teaches it in a way that can impact your life. He does an amazing job connecting ancient works to today's world and really makes you think about things differently. Online quizzes and papers are a breeze.

Dr. Lipp was an awesome professor. His lectures are informative and interesting. Your grade is made up by 10 quizzes (online so open note) and 3 papers (1 page each) so NO EXAMS! If you know some basic greek myths this should be a very easy A. I didn'tt even read the assigned text and did fine.

Dr. Lipp is a great professor who is very clear on what he expects of his students. He has very fun and thought provoking lectures. The reading can be tedious at times but if you keep up with the text his lectures and class become so much easier. Very easy grading system.

Dr. Lipp explains the readings so well in lectures that you probably don't even have to read outside of class. If you take good notes, then you can do well on the weekly quizzes. These weekly quizzes are worth a huge bulk of your grade and the lowest quiz grade is dropped. These quizzes plus 3 one-page papers make up your total grade. No exams.

Probably an easy A if you read the novels he assigns (66% of grade based on 12 quizzes about themes discussed IN LECTURE & comparison of characters), but as a premed taking 18 credits, I have other priorities so it's my own fault. I have a B and stopped going to lecture after week 3 or 4. Also turned in a paper late (I hate writin) I recommend Lipp
Not many grades in overall, and 66% of the overall consists of online quizzes. Make sure you remember to take them, if not it will hurt your grade.

Dr. Lipp was very clear in what material he wanted you to know. I went to every lecture and took good notes and never needed the books. He is a bit full of himself, but he is entertaining. Attend lecture and you'll do fine. He announces bonus during lecture to make people attend. I would definitely recommend taking him and Classical Mythology.

Lectures could sometimes put you to sleep but over all probably easiest class I've taken.   He tells you exactly what you need to know for quizzes. Also his papers are only a page long, can be tough to get all you want to say in a paper, but a very low stress class if thats what you need.

I appreciated learning from the perspective of this professor.  He made the material come to life, such that I could understand and appreciate the material on a much deeper level than what I got from just reading the texts on my own. Warning: it's a ton of dense reading for a non-major class; the TA's are tough graders, so work hard on the essays!

Dr. Lipp is so passionate about the novels that he teaches and he made me look at them in a way that I didn't expect. I would absolutely take another class with this professor. He seems like an all-around good person and he made me enjoy classic novels, something that I was never really interested in experiencing before this class.
Very entertaining lecturer. You must read the books then the class is a breeze.

Dr. Lipp was a great professor for Classical Mythology.  He was so passionate about the subject, and he was also really funny.  I liked how much he connected with the class, and I think the class really respected him.  His quizzes were really easy, but the essays required you to have read the books and gone to lecture.

I loved Dr. Lipp's class! I didn't have a lot of background in the course, but he was enthusiastic to help the class understand the background material. If you won't read the books, don't take this course. The papers you write are dependent on the in-course readings. I found the readings very interesting, though. Class discussion is very helpful!

Professor Lipp took over my mythology class when our other professor had to go on medical leave. He is a wonderful teacher! You HAVE to go to lecture to do well in the class, but if you go to lecture it will be an easy A. The only grades are online quizzes every week and three one page essays. Take this class, I highly highly recommend it!!!!

summary_comment: Professor Hutwohl is known for his engaging and interactive teaching style, which effectively combines classical texts with modern materials such as videos and contemporary reimaginings, making the study of Latin both lively and relevant. His deep knowledge of Latin allows him to provide insightful, on-the-spot feedback, enhancing students' understanding. While the course occasionally delves into potentially somber topics related to death in ancient cultures, it remains highly informative and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hutwohl (referred to as Dannu) delivers high-quality instruction with an engaging and interactive approach, making complex subjects accessible through on-the-spot feedback, classical texts, and innovative materials like videos and contemporary reimaginings. His knowledge of Latin is extensive, enhancing the learning experience and bringing historical contexts to life.

Ratings.comment: Laid back teaching style but still in a way that makes you learn! Dannu is so knowledgeable about Latin that he can give on the spot feedback, which helps to reinforce what you learn. Interactive and on the spot reading and participation helps you synthesize what you learn. He also includes tidbits and facts that bring the world of Latin to life.

Engaging, energetic, enthusiastic, and well-informed presentations employing not only the classical texts, but materials outside the box, like videos of a hip-hop artist, a modern great leader's funeral procession, and a contemporary re-imagining, plus a solid foundation of the classical literature itself. Dannu makes you want to keep learning!

When I had his class, he was a doctoral student. Group discussion is a must if you don't want him to change the style of the course to lots of tests and quizzes. Focuses on death in ancient Rome and Greece, so the subject matter can be a little depressing if you don't like that kind of stuff. Take his class, but make sure to read the material.

summary_comment: Professor Kaldellis is highly regarded for his engaging and knowledgeable lectures, which expand students' perspectives and make the subject matter interesting. Students find him challenging but rewarding, with a tough grading system that ensures thorough learning. While some comment on the structured nature of the course and the importance of consistent performance, overall, Professor Kaldellis is praised for his teaching abilities and the value of his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kaldellis is highly regarded for his engaging and informative lectures, with students praising his extensive knowledge and ability to expand students' thinking. Despite being a tough grader and expecting a lot from students, his classes are generally considered valuable and enjoyable, though some note the lack of frequent grading can impact final grades.

Ratings.comment: I really liked Dr. Kaldelliss class. I genuinely feel like my mind was expanded and I was thinking about things I had never thought of before. My main complaint is that he didnt put in a lot of grades so if you did badly on one paper or participation then your grade was ruined, but the class was easy + the papers + reading were very reasonable.

Professor Kaldellis is without a doubt my favorite professor at Ohio State. I took his Late Roman Empire class as a GenEd and walked away extremely satisfied and wanting more. His lectures are extremely interesting and you can tell he knows a ton about the subject. He is a tough grader, and getting a good grade is tough, but you will learn so much.

Anthony is funny to listen to and keeps his lectures engaging. The only homework there was in this class was readings and some short (2-5 page) papers. He does grade the papers, so you should put effort into those. There were also quizzes throughout the semester, but as long as you read, they're easy.

Really fun to listen to, funny, and crazy smart.  I'm still counting the number of languages this guy knows. Expects a lot from you. Has "required" readings, but honestly I haven't bought the books and only skim the articles on carmen. Not many points at all so easy to have a low grade. Will work with you for EC if you contact him.
Amazing Teacher!!! Really interesting and knows alot.  Fun to listen to and the class is unstructured compared to most classes, so you can talk about pretty much anything.  I totally recommend
Brilliant.  Lots of fun to listen to.  If you aren't a good writer, you might be in trouble.

He was kind of intimidating at first, but he's actually a really nice guy. Extremely smart and knowledgeable. Interesting discussion and lectures. Tough grader and expects a lot out of you but the class is definitely worth it.
The discussions were always interesting.  Lots of reading, and he expects you to get it done.  Fair paper grader.  Really fun professor.
Very good teacher and was enjoyable to listen to.
Very easy, didn't pick up the book other than the first week or too look at some maps. Go to lecture and you'll do fine in there.
An okay lecturer, The TA's will e of more applicable help. Read the books and revise papers. Not bad, not the best ever.

Amazing professor. There's no one else like him. A revisionist and political discontent who loves tangents but always relates them to the material. Knows more than anyone else I've ever met. Take his class. And for the love of God, revise your papers.
Amazingly smart teacher leads to amazingly interesting class discussions.  I highly recommend him, if you're not opposed to thinking.

A gem at OSU.  Revisionist Byzantinist who knows EVERYTHING.  Very clear and loves stories.  Will go onto tangents lecturing wildly for hours.  Love this prof.  PS: Check your papers and you'll do fine.
This class was great fun and Kaldellis is a very nice guy. He's a really tough grader though, so make your papers really good!

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Graduate Seminar on Late Antiquity and Byzantium

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Political Thought and Institutions in the Greco-Roman World

summary_comment: Professor Heiden is known for his deep knowledge of classical literature and strong passion for the subject, which often translates into engaging discussions. However, his lectures can be challenging to follow without prior reading, and his teaching style is sometimes described as confusing and boring. Students find the class manageable if they prepare well, particularly by focusing on essay prompts provided in advance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Heiden is highly knowledgeable and passionate about classical literature, making the subject engaging for those who prepare thoroughly. However, his lectures can be confusing and boring for some students, and he heavily emphasizes class discussions and themes in his grading, which can be challenging without consistent preparation and engagement.

Ratings.comment: I had this professor for zoom lectures. He was very knowledgable on the subject, but you'd be a bit lost if you didn't read the passages for that week. He is super passionate about everything, and the midterms and final are honestly not hard as long as you prepare the essay prompts that are given.

Lectures were so confusing and boring. (for an English teacher, he should be able to create a linear sentence??) Test heavy. He does post 3 possible essay questions before the test, so you can make outlines beforehand and memorize them for the test. He will repeat some themes in the lectures, and including them in your essay is easy points.

This class was horrible. He has no idea how to use technology and has no idea how to present. Constantly talked about nothing but could seriously drag it on for hours. He was an easy grader for essays, but difficult multiple choice questions. If you do not read the required readings you will not pass. Super uninteractive class

Professor Heiden loves talking about classical literature. The lectures can be a little boring but sometimes he manages to make them interesting. Overall, he is a great guy who is passionate about what he teaches.

First day I wanted to drop bc he seemed boring but it turned out to be super easy. I didnt buy any of the books I just read sparknotes and got an A. All you have to do is take good notes so that when you get the essay prompts you already have written down everything he said and you just type it out. All you have to do is take good notes in lecture

Avoid this class with every ounce of your being. You will hate your life taking this course, there are easier GE's out there. He doesn't help with questions when you ask him and grades insanely hard. His exams are impossible and theres abundance of reading. Do yourself a favor and pick another class. You're welcome!

He has random pop quizzes over the reading. Grade is determined from 2 midterm essay exams, one take home paper, and a final essay exam. He drones on and on in class and never writes anything down. He will penalize you for not including topics discussed in class in your essays. He doesn't really appear to put much effort into the class.

Dr. Heiden can be a little confusing in his overall lecturing.  That being said, he is very clear about what he finds important from the readings.  He will beat certain themes into your head.  However, his lectures can be a little roundabout and confusing, but if you've actually done the readings you can easily get an A i his class.

Very passionate professor, but he talks in circles and is very opinionated without offering clarity.  The course is a lot of reading, and he puts some odd philosophical twists on everything that don't always make sense.  He and the TA's have FAR too high expectations on the essays of this 100-level course and offers poor communication overall.

This class is a lot of work if you want an A, you can do almost nothing and get a B, but you have to put in a lot of time for an A. Your essay grades depend on your recitation TA. I got lucky with the easy-going TA. There is a TON of reading to keep up with. It's not just an easy GEC!
He talks in circles constantly.  The TA's grade too harshly. I wouldn't take this unless it is required. I did all the reading, attended every lecture and still had a hard time.
Terrible for a 1xx level class. He and the TAs had inappropriate expectations. Hard lecturer and seems only to care about his own opinion.

Worst GEC choice I've made in college.  You can get an A, but it requires way too much reading and essay writing.  I think he thinks the students get off to Greek writing as much as he does.  Not the case.  Awful.
Classics 101-Very hard to follow in lecture and understand. Definitely knows he material and is interested but just doesn't describe clearly. AVOID if not a literature major!
A great professor. Knows exactly what he's talking about. Exams are easy if you study. Must go to class though. Will get points taken off if you don't.
read the sparknotes, go to class occasionally and do the bonus you should get an easy A
WANTS YOU TO MEMORIZE AND SPIT OUT EVERYTHING HE SAYS.
a wonderful teacher

Very good professor. Lectures can be a bit boring but if you go you will have no problems passing. He goes over everything he wants you to know. Very good GEC class. Really easy, especially with EC papers that add up to point value of about 2 exams. Get to drop one exam also. Very easy. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
I enjoyed this class, though I could be a little boring.  Definitely do the study guides, and with the option of extra credit there's no reason to get an A or B.
Bruce seems like a really nice guy. The class was Extremely Easy. Don't have to go to class but if you do there is no reason to read anything not even sparknotes...
Just read the stories and/or sparknotes and you dont need to attend lecture. Do the bonus papers and this is an automatic A+
OMG, SCHEDULE THIS CLASS IMMEDIATELY! EASY A+!!! TESTS ARE SO EASY. READ THE STORIES AND YOU GOT AN A.
I like it when Bruce claps to us in class and yells at people for talking. The class is so easy!

This class is an EASY A:  I wouldn't go to the lectures, it takes him 20 minutes to tell you what one sentence on sparknotes will.  Look at the study guides on the website- make sure you know the answers to the questions on those.  Buy+read the Anthology book.  Use sparknotes for Illiad and Gilgamesh.  Full texts of Metamorphoses are online.

Bruce rambles and say uh more than he talks about the stories.  His class is the easiest A you could ask for. You can earn up to 14 points extra credit and the final exam is a bunch of repeat or practically repeat questions. Don't bother going to lecture, just go to recitation and read the stories on sparknotes or bookrags.
Prof Heiden is an awesome teacher!

Pretty easy class, don't go to lecture. Bless spark notes for helping you with the study guides. IF you know those, the exams are really easy. He drops your lowest score and you can get bonus points pretty effortlessly.

The class was not very hard. The readings are straightforward and I actually very rarely read the stuff.  My TA was very helpful with information. The tests were not very hard and they give so many bonus points you should be able to easily get an A.
really easy if you look at the study guides before the exam...don't waste money on the books, use sparknotes!
MOST BORING PROFESSOR EVER! MONOTONE. EASY CLASS. THE EASIEST CLASS IF YOU READ THE BOOKS! FILL OUT THE STUDY GUIDES, THOSE ARE BASICALLY THE EXAMS.

Not too bad at the beginning of the quarter, but towards the end, his lectures made me want to shoot myself in the face they were so boring.  (He just likes to hear himself talk).  4 papers so not too hard.  You can probably even get by without reading the books.

Easiest class I have ever taken.  Don't waste time and go to lecture (I didn't the last month).  The way he has extra credit, you should get an A if you got admitted into this school.  Don't bother buying the books as you can find sparknotes versions of all of them.  No class on Fridays.  The online study guide is all you need to get an A

The lectures were shoot-yourself-in-the-face boring, but the exams were super easy and no class on Fridays of non-exam weeks. Read on your own and do the study guides, and you might not have to go to lecture a whole lot. Good GEC if you need a class that doesn't take up a whole lot of time.

This has been the most boring class I have taken here and it doesn't even count towards any GEC credits like I thought it would.  I though I was going to be taking a classics greek class and it turned out to be all about decision making.  Heiden is also extremely boring.
LOTS of reading, but no class on Friday!
its an easy pick-up course.  no friday classes, all notes on-line, moderate reading, prepares you well for the test.
No Friday classes, very easy tests.  Dont even bother buying the books.  All the plays are on sparknotes. Just read those and you'll get an A.  Also, no need to attend lecture. everything is online
no fri. class....just read the notes on line and the test will be vary easy
Not too many people went to lecture cause most of the course was reading, but he was pretty funny.  Canceled class Fridays and the tests weren't too tough.  Interesting class.  Highly reccomend.

The reading isn't too bad, just print the study guides on line and go to class.  Those are the only notes you need to take to do the tests.  He drops the lowest test grade, and adds extra credit to tests.  Easy tests.  No papers.
Kind of a lot of reading, but easy A if you read- All notes posted online and usually no classes on Friday.
No Comments
Let's just say we like to call this class "Who Dud Who in 222".  This class is like story time and although it's on the schedule for five days a week, Heiden only held it four days.

SEI.Subject: GREEK
SEI.Class Name: Graduate Seminar on Greek Literature and Culture

summary_comment: Professor Ziemann is known for delivering engaging and clear lectures that cover the necessary material thoroughly. Students find his courses enjoyable and relatively easy, with doable quizzes and exams that align closely with the lecture content. His teaching style is praised for making complex topics accessible and encouraging active participation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ziemann is known for delivering clear and comprehensive lectures that cover all necessary material for quizzes and exams, making the course relatively easy and enjoyable. His teaching style is engaging and supportive, fostering a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: This course had a few online lectures and readings each week. There was also a quiz based on the lecture content each week. The lectures were fun sometimes! Overall this course was enjoyable and easy! (Just make sure to watch the lectures!)

I took this class asynchronously and I found it to be really chill. Dr. Ziemann would upload a very doable amount of lecture content for classwork with one quiz each week. There is nothing on the quizzes or exams that are not brought up in class. Dr. Ziemann is very clear about all of the important concepts and reiterates them throughout lecture.

Dr. Ziemann was a great professor. 2220H was very lecture heavy with readings every night, but you really don't need to read since he summarizes every myth in lecture. Honors had to write a paper which was kind of annoying during finals season, but overall great class, easy A to fulfill a GE.

Dr. Ziemann was a great prof. I had him for classical mythology (honors) and it was an easy A. Super easy quizzes every few weeks, easy exams, one short paper. He posts powerpoints of the notes and is a fair grader. He encourages discussion and makes sure everyone understands the readings. Would recommend taking him to knock out a gen ed.

I took Mythology for a GE credit and it was a great choice. Dr. Ziemann makes all grades assignments for the class (quizzes and exams) online and open note. There is an attendance grade, but he warns you what days hell be taking attendance prior. Attendance isnt mandatory but Id really recommend going to class. Easy A for sure

Professor Z is an awesome Latin instructor. He is funny, charming, and charismatic. He is witty and makes learning Latin fun. He dresses like he's fifty and puts his students at ease with his deep soothing voice.

summary_comment: Professor Al-Jallad is highly regarded for his engaging and passionate lectures, which are both thought-provoking and easy to follow. Students consistently praise his enthusiasm and dedication to making complex subjects accessible and interesting. His focus is on fostering a deep interest in the subject matter rather than heavy grading, and he is known for being generous with feedback and readily available during office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Al-Jallad is highly regarded for his engaging and passionate lectures, which are both thought-provoking and easy to follow. Students consistently praise his dedication to making complex subjects accessible and interesting, often leading them to explore additional resources out of personal interest rather than academic necessity.

Ratings.comment: Def take him more for his lectures than any class work.

Dr. Al-Jallad is the best professor I've had. He's intelligent and extremely passionate about his field, with an infectious enthusiasm that makes lectures lively and interesting. You can get away with skipping some readings, although you'll probably be hooked enough to explore them on your own. Don't worry about the grades; enjoy the experience.

Professor Al-Jallad is one of the most passionate professors whose passion is undoubtedly matched by their mastery of the subject. Lectures are thought-provoking and easy to follow. He's more concerned with making students just as fascinated he is than he is with assignments. Generous feedback and available for office hours with tea! Take him!

Best professor and best class at OSU by a million. Every class had very very high-level discussions which I could honestly never get anywhere. OSU needs to cherish Ahmad and this class and publicize it a lot more because I believe every Muslim or anyone interested in Islam NEEDS to take this course. He is a very light grader and very personable.

SEI.Subject: ARABIC
SEI.Class Name: Classical and Medieval Arabic Literature in Translation

SEI.Subject: ARABIC
SEI.Class Name: Classical and Medieval Arabic Literature in Translation

SEI.Class Name: Classical and Medieval Arabic Literature in Translation

SEI.Class Name: Classical and Medieval Arabic Literature in Translation

SEI.Class Name: Classical and Medieval Arabic Literature in Translation

SEI.Subject: NELC
SEI.Class Name: Grammar of Selected Ancient Near Eastern Languages

summary_comment: Professor Blume has received mixed reviews, with some students finding him engaging and knowledgeable, particularly in his passion for Roman Civilization, while others criticize his teaching style as unfocused and uninteresting. Despite varying opinions, many appreciate his fairness in grading, extra credit opportunities, and overall approachability, though some find his humor and personality inconsistent.
summary_comment_short: Professor Blume is known for being knowledgeable and passionate about his subject, particularly Roman Civilization, making his lectures engaging despite the topic's inherent challenges. However, some students find his teaching style less structured, with grading sometimes unclear and topics occasionally straying from the syllabus.

Ratings.comment: 3 total grades for the class, only one was graded before the last day of classes. Failed to stay on topic and didn't make the subject interesting. Doesn't elaborate his standards. Funny guy, but not great at teaching. Worst class I have taken so far.

He is a great professor! The class is only graded on a couple things, so make sure to go over his slideshows before the quizzes. He is a very chill professor and is very accommodating, especially with all the covid protocols. I would 100% take another class with him.

Blume is a funny guy, who gave good lectures on a topic that really wasn't that interesting. Class was made up of quizzes and two tests that were not difficult if you went to class. Recommend taking one of his courses, would be interested in taking another myself.

Professor Blume is an amazing instructor. Super knowledgeable and passionate about Roman Civilization. Class was always interesting and always on topic. He is the perfect professor for this class and I wish I could take it again because hes just that great. Hes also just an all around bro and is super chill while remaining serious. 10/10 epic guy

Professor Blume is honestly one of the best classics professors Ive had! Hes very fair with grading and offers plenty of extra credit. Having taken his class, I would highly recommend it. Reading is heavy, but the books are interesting reads so nothing too boring. Also grading is based off one essay and two exams. Would definitely take again.
This man is fairly funny but honestly is kind of a jerk too. At least he puts things bluntly though. Im always so excited when he cancels class though, best part of my day.

Hank might not be the greatest professor in terms of teaching, but he makes up for it with charm, care for his students, and depth of knowledge of the subject. If you put in the minimal effort for this class you will come out with an A; just make sure you at least go to class if you don't read the books. One of my favorite classes and lecturers.

This class was very deceiving. I was under the impression that if you just showed up to lecture and gave a little bit of effort that this class would be passable. However, for a 3 credit class that people probably are only taking for GE credit, it requires a lot more work than what I would consider ideal. There are better options, trust me

Couldn't disagree more with whoever wrote the last review. There is a lot of reading in the class, but spark notes/lectures are just fine. Hank is so thorough with context/main ideas from readings. We had a response paper (easy), a midterm (easy) and have a group work final. Not to mention he's precious and hilarious.

The WORST class I have ever taken. I only took him because of the reviews on here, BIG MISTAKE! There is A LOT of reading and your grade is only based off of like four things so if you do poorly on one of them youll most likely end up with a poor grade.
Taught us how atomic bombs work r8 8/8 gr8

Take his class!! Easy A!! 3 papers a semester, 1 page MAX double spaced. I never read a single book and still got an A on every midterm. Offers extra credit after each midterm. You're graded on few assignments, but they're easy. He's also funny and tries to make a classical literature class as fun as it can be

Hank is a super cool guy, but very unorganized. He's really slow about putting grades in and his TAs grade tough! Def not an easy A and requires work, however if you attend lecture regularly you should be good to go! Hank is really good about not making lecture boring, and he's hot which is a plus

Hilarious, interesting guy. His lectures aren't incredible but he does a great job summarizing the material we had to read. The class itself is easy but having Hank as a professor made it far more enjoyable than it would have been.

Here's the thing, Hank is the bomb dot com, but the class isn't easy peasy lemon squeezy. So get ready to read about 4 books and an online story, or be able to use spark notes. The last 2 books for the final are not on there though, you have been warned. He is funny, and wants all of his students to succeed. Great guy!!

Honestly the love of my life. He is an incredible professor - best I've ever had. He's so smart and passionate with what he is talking about. Minimal papers but not hard to write at all. Great class, great professor. Absolutely recommend taking this class!!!

Hank is the bomb. Great guy and really personable. His class is a couple of essays (one page long) and 3 exams. show up and pay attention and you won't have to read the books. The TA's can be a little tough on grading so be careful. For the final we created a google doc and shared our notes(with his permission). Best professor ever!!

Hank is an exceptional professor who connects well with students. He seems to understand the material very well and makes it easy to understand. Also, he is laid back and doesn't act like he is better than all the students.

He takes random attendance throughout the semester, not any specific day. Some of the books that are read, the lectures need to be attended to get a good grade. There are some papers that are not hard to write and are short. It is a ton of reading, though and the exams can be somewhat hard.
Hank is a really nice guy who makes Latin fun!
Random attendance checks throughout semester for participation points, 3 exams and short papers. Understand the books; overall not too bad.

Unlike his name suggests, Hank Blume is actually young, super funny and a little awkward. He does a nice job of presenting his material and definitely seems to know what he is talking about. The intro class has a lot of reading, but if you just go to class and take notes you honestly can still get an A.

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Sports and Spectacles in the Ancient World

summary_comment: Professor Fisher is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining teaching style, which makes his classes enjoyable and easy to follow. Students consistently praise his dedication to ensuring student learning and his charismatic, kind-hearted approach. His teaching methods, including open-book quizzes, are seen as effective due to his unique ability to foster genuine interest and retention among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fisher is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining teaching style, which makes his classes enjoyable and effective for learning. Students consistently praise his dedication to ensuring students understand the material and care about their academic success.

Ratings.comment: I would 100% recommend taking any of scotts classes he is very understanding and makes sure that all of his students want to learn and is very entertaining to listen to and hilarious, loved his class!
Scott was my favorite prof this semester. He cares a lot about you and has mutual respect. He is very detailed and has story telling based lectures, making it easy to listen and follow along.

He is honestly the best professor here at OSU Marion. He actually has social skills unlike some of the other professors, he actually cares about you and your academics, and he is very charismatic and genuinely kind-hearted. His class was very fun and easy, and if you just listen to what he has to offer in his lectures, you'll do great.

Mr. Fisher genuinely cares about you and your education. While attendence is not mandatory I would highly recommend showing up to his classes. You will learn a lot more than just classics. In recent years his classes have become a bit more difficult, as OSU pressures him to use more concrete testing formats. His projects are interesting and simple.
He is a great guy and really cares about helping you get a good grade. One of the best people I've met!

I'm surprised the school allows him to grade the way he does, i.e., quizzes, etc., are all open-book (or internet, or classmates, etc), but it actually works. I think most people actually retain most of the information, despite not really having to to do well in the course. I think it comes down to his personality and teaching style. It just works.

I found that his class was not only easy but I retained more knowledge than any other class. You will have no trouble showing up to Scott's classes bc they are interesting and entertaining. Best Class ever:)
No Comments

He is a funny guy who enjoys teaching. His class is fun. 20 essay questions, usually 12-15 are take home and the rest you work in class with group. You watch some movies. I enjoyed taking this class and you only use the book for tests. Highly recommended!

this guy is awesome, he really knows his stuff and loves life and what he's teaching.  He really doesn't believe in stand. testing, so all tests are group/take home/easy/fun.  Take this class!!!  Prof. Fisher has a GREAT personaity and is a great guy, so give his classes a chance! gl
