summary_comment: Professor Jusdanis is known for his passionate teaching style and commitment to his students, though his classes require substantial reading and frequent writing. Students appreciate his availability and engagement, but also note that the material can be challenging and the lectures sometimes difficult to follow. Overall, his classes demand significant effort but can be manageable with consistent participation and thorough preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jusdanis is known for his passionate approach to teaching, though his classes require extensive reading and frequent writing. Students appreciate his availability and engagement, though some find his lectures challenging and suggest focusing on class discussions and powerpoints for better performance.

Ratings.comment: Be prepared for a class of reading at a fast pace and writing papers. There were five papers, and two midterms. The midterms weren't difficult if you do the reading. I'd recommend you read most of the books, but you can skip one or two and cliff note it if you're busy.

Take notes in class and keep them! They will be very helpful for your final exam. Lots of reading, but all discussed in class and makes it all easy to understand. Easy to talk to and engage with. Essays are seven pages long, double-spaced- seems like a lot but isn't too bad. The more feedback from your outline you use, the higher grade on essay.

I loved Prof Jusdanis. His lecture's were hard to stay awake through, but I could tell he really loved his job. He's very passionate about his profession and loves his students as well. Get ready to read a whole lot. If you aren't one to read books, I bid you good luck.
What a fantastic professor! I took this as a GE, but it was my favorite class of this semester! He's so passionate and engaging and his class was very easy to succeed in!

I loved this class, specifically because of the professor! I just took it for a GE, but it ended up being my most enjoyed class. He is clearly passionate about what he teaches. He does grade based on participation (but it's easy), so you have to go to class for those points but i never felt like he gave me an unfair grade & assignments were easy.

An incredibly compelling and passionate man. The readings in the class can be difficult to understand, but he always takes time to clarify anything the class does not understand. He was flexible when I had to miss class. Available outside of class almost all of the time. Go into this class with your best effort and you will do well.
His lectures are extremely boring!! Just reading his powerpoints before exams will be fine for a good grade. He makes you do 4 one page papers that are very easy.

So the TAs mainly do the grading for this class, but there's only 4 papers to write, but don't be shocked if you get 9.5/10 on almost all of them. The tests are super easy IF YOU READ!! you cannot get an A without reading all the readings and they'll be hard to sparknote, but some can be found.
Greg is the best! He grades essays really easy. The class is very interesting and engaging, and he is one of my favorite professors!

Prof. Jusdanis is a real bro. He was always super kind and caring, and his passion for his subject definitely shows. He is an able teacher, and helps you get excited about stuff you might not care about. There was quite a bit of reading to do at times but it's college, so do the reading and you'll get an A.

Excellent lectures. Prof. Jusdanis is very passionate in his field. Although I'm not majoring in Classics, his passion and genuine care for students encouraged me to come to his lectures and read the assigned textbooks. Would definitely recommend one of his classes. One of OSU's finest professors, without a doubt.

An awesome professor. I didn't have any interest in the subject matter, but his teaching style and passion for it made me want to come to class. There is a lot of reading, but doing it pays off. Exams are essentially extended reading comprehension tests, so reading the book results in an easy A. Essays are slightly more strictly graded, but not bad

Probably the best professor I've had at this university. His stories are very engaging and he is very genuine. There was quite a bit of reading in his class, but it is completely doable. I was looking at a B for my final grade in his class, but he allowed me to write a two-page paper to bump it up to an A. Take this guy if you have the chance.

Prof. Jusdanis is great, he's very friendly and welcoming and genuinely wants his students to enjoy his class. He's not too tough of a grader and will give specific feedback about what you could do better.

He was a great Intro to Classic Lit prof. Very passionate about the subject matter and tried to get students equally interested. Picked good reading material and exams are very easy (one short essay and a few "pick 4 of the 10 options and talk about them" sections. Essay assignments may be tricky for worse writers, but overall an enjoyable class.

Lectures are unnecessary to go to, but are somewhat enjoyable. Read the books, go over the slides and you'll do well. Essays are graded easily. Exam essays given in advance. You get to pick from a selection of short answer questions. Seems to care about students.

I really don't know how I feel about him. He didn't assign us long papers but was unnecessarily nit picky about grading. Lots of reading that I mostly didn't do and was fine. Couple class presentations we had to do but they were short. He likes participation and likes to talk about himself

Mod Greed Lit. TOUGH grader. You have to write 7 page papers. SO you have to try really hard. You READ 5 books! You have to memorize every single thing you've read, text, author, titles, etc for the final. YOU WILL READ A LOT. Classes are boring he just makes you read aloud then he reads right after what you just read. POINTLESS.

After a semester I can't really say how I feel about Professor Jusdanis. I know he is very excited about his own work, however, it comes off conceited at points. I was having trouble with a paper, so I went to office hours, and after he said he would have time to read a paper, he refused to spend more than ten minutes. There was over an hour left.

He does assign a lot of readings, but he's super approachable, friendly, and passionate about his works. He is an endearing man who I have really enjoyed class with. As a world lit major, I enjoy reading so it wasn't too hard of a class for me.
A very entertaining class, though it involved TONS of reading.  Jusdanis is a great guy, once you get used to his quirks and sense of humor.
Tough grader who expects a lot of effort, perhaps a little too much considering the low grades he hands out on papers. Intelligent and often funny. Overall, he teaches a very interesting class.

This is a class you have to know you will be interested in before you sign up, or you will be bored to tears.  I was interested and, in my opinion, he tackled such a seeminly impossibly broad subject very well.  Papers assignments were broad, but that's the point.  On top of that, he was just a pleasure to wake up to in the morning, great guy.

Nice guy, but this class will make you want to kill yourself of boredom.  I get the feeling he did not prepare any kind of lecture whatsoever, so everyone just talks and you end up having no idea what any of the 40,000 reading assignments meant.  This will be your most expensive class by far as he couldnt be bothered to put anything on e reserve.

10 weeks is way too long to talk about Nationalism. I really looked forward to the class but by the time we got to week five it became a chore and the discussions seemed repetitive. Grades consisted of two seven+ page papers and a final based on a ton of reading. Jusdanis is a great guy, but he couldnt keep me interested in the material.

Prof. Jusdanis requires hard work but I found that most of my class respected him and was willing to put in the necessary work.  This was also a course outside of his traditional discipline, so I suppose it would be interesting for me to take one of his lit courses.

The class is not too hard.  Two papers and a final.  It is a lot of reading though.  He also has the harshest attendance system I've ever seen.  You get 2% of your final grade for EVERY class you miss.
I thought this class wasn't going to be bad so I took it as a GEC, but we ended up with a lot of reading, having to write two papers, taking a huge final, and the class had mandatory participation.

summary_comment: Professor Gaber's online courses are highly organized and well-structured, with engaging and informative lectures that tie into the course material. Students find the class easy, with exams consisting largely of repeated quiz questions, making it a low-maintenance option for fulfilling general education requirements.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gaber's online courses are highly organized and well-structured, featuring engaging and informative lectures that complement the course material. Her exams primarily consist of repeated quiz questions, making the class relatively easy and straightforward for students who engage with the required readings and quizzes.

Ratings.comment: This course is asynchronous, so rather than "lectures" there are slides and required readings on mythology. The slides are well made and the required readings aren't too bad. Quizzes are straightforward and non-tricky, exams repeat quiz questions, discussion posts are fun since mythology is a very cool subject.

Prof. Garber's online class was very well organized. She is really smart and good at explaining things. The class is easy with exam questions that are copied from the weekly quizzes. Low maintenance and also kind of interesting. Garber is cool and approachable.

This is definitely one of the easiest gen eds to take. Lectures are intresting and informative.
There are 3 exams made up entirely of questions you had on quizzes throughout the semster.

Easiest class I've ever taken, lectures are actually interesting but to be honest you don't have to attend a single one to get an A in the class. Weekly quizzes are free 100s and the test use the same questions as the quizzes.
I took this class to fulfill my last GE, and it was an easy A. Very little effort is needed to succeed in this class. Professor is accessible outside of class.

The professor was very informative during lectures, which tied in well with the course material; this allowed for the opportunity to think deeper. Literature is admittedly far from being my forte, but this was a course well worth taking.
Took her async class. This is one of the easiest gen eds to take. Would recommend for anyone looking for an easy A.

Dr. Gaber's class is a very good GE to take. She is a good lecturer, and you will do well if you put in the effort to read most of the material and attend class. She hits key points for understanding during lecture, and her tests are not bad at all. Overall the class was fun and interesting.

I took greek mythology online with Gaber, the class met Mon/Wed/Fri on zoom, but she posts recordings of the lectures on Carmen. There are weekly quizzes that mostly cover the lecture material and the larger exams are composed of questions from the same pool as the quizzes. Gaber is very personable, even the zoom lectures are worth attending!

Took Classics1101 last semester and enjoyed all the literature we read, her lectures really add to the material and make it more engaging to read the longer novels and works. Exams followed the quizzes pretty closely and she always made sure to offer alternative options for other big grades like the seminar/discussions since the class was online.
Professor Gaber's lectures were clear and the slides she prepared to go with them were awesome! Easy grader but you have to read the material.

Amazing professor and lecturer. Took her class for easy gen ed credits and left the class wanting to learn more! Super knowledgeable and thoroughly interested in what she teaches. She knows some of us cant read a lot for hw so assigns accordingly too! Really interesting lectures and topics, while keeping workload small! Would recommend for all!

If you are looking for an interesting and easy gen ed, take her class! She is very understanding when it comes to deadlines and understands that most people take the class for GE credit. There are open note quizzes every week and you have two attempts at them, easy As. The exams are easy as well. Watch the lectures and you will do well. Loved it.

This class was a good gen ed class. there are weekly quizzes you get 2 attempts at which are pretty easy. the tests had multiple choice questions from previous quizzes which was nice, but the writing part was kind of hard and it was easy to run out of time. as long as you watch lectures/know what's going on you'll be fine

Professor Gaber is great! You get two attempts on the weekly quiz and have three easy unit exams. She posts a practice exam before each exam and uses the same questions on both so you know exactly what she is asking you. She also lets you do a short writing assessment instead of a socratic seminar if you don't like talking in class.

Professor Gaber is awesome. Their lectures are always do a great job of covering the material. If you have even a little bit of knowledge in Ancient Greco-Roman literature, you are all set for this class. All the texts are very palatable, and you get multiple chances on the quizzes. Even if you put in minimal effort, you will easily pass.

Professor Gaber was a solid instructor for a gen-ed. There were weekly online quizzes which allowed for two attempts and should be an easy 100%. There were three exams (noncumulative) covering different poems we were supposed to read for class. I personally did not read any of the content and I still did fine.

Dr. Gaber is one of the best professors, especially during the pandemic. She was always available, a fast replier via email, and was always helpful when struggling. The class had 5 longer (the more detailed the better) weekly response questions, a quiz every other week, 5 character sheets, and 1 final exam. If you put in the work, you will get an A

Gaber is a great professor. The workload consists of a couple of readings with 10 reading questions and a quiz once a week. Also, there are a couple of exams throughout the year that were open book for us. As long as you do the work and go to class, you will get an A.

Gaber is an amazing professor. I cant recommend her enough. She wants her students to learn and fall in love with her passion, and it shows. She requests class participation, but no one is penalized for not participating. I took this class for a GE & I am very glad I did. I plan to ask what other classes she teaches. Work load is extremely easy.

summary_comment: Professor Bourgeois is highly knowledgeable and engaging, though his lectures can be challenging to follow initially. His classes are generally well-structured, and he encourages student participation and discussion, making the material accessible and thought-provoking by the end of the semester. Students find his passion for the subject contagious, and while some note that the class can become stale, overall, he is seen as a caring and supportive instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bourgeois is highly knowledgeable and structured his courses effectively, though his initial lectures can be challenging and overwhelming. Students find him engaging once they adapt, and many appreciate his passion for the subject and generous grading.

Ratings.comment: Professor Bourgeois is so incredibly knowledgeable about his stuff that you'll spend the first few lectures unraveling the ramblings of a madman. However, the course is structured well enough (and he's a good enough lecturer) that you'll be able to discuss the nuances of said ramblings by the end of the semester.

Prof. Bourgeois was awesome. In my 1st semester in TO, I was super nervous and was initially put off by his heavy reading list. However, everything we read (and later discussed in class) was so engaging and thought-provoking that the time spent on it didn't matter. Take him if you're given the choice!

The class was basically just a reading/discussion of various Latin texts, and Brandon made it pretty straightforward and engaging, for the most part. Lectures were important since he delineated what to understand from each text, and he was very generous in his assessments and overall grading. At times, class got a bit stale, but overall good!

Don't do it. Just don't. Signed up for this class at USC because it was the only GESM that fit in my schedule with open seats. Enjoyed it at first, but over time it became clear that he is very arrogant, pretentious, and expects way too much of college freshman in a GE. He tears apart your work and made my entire class feel inadequate.

He is a great professor and for an upper division class it is pretty easy. He loves the subject and is more worried about learning then grades. I would highly recommend this class he truly cares about roman law- don't let the course description scare you. Would recommend - just read and engage in lecture!

Clearly cares deeply about the subject, has a really cool rap of the Iliad. Grades are not difficult. Would highly recommend this class. I found that he responded to my emails within 24 hours, lectures were heavy on getting people involved, and lectures can be engaging if you do the reading!
Easy GE but Brandon is uncooperative, difficult to reach by email etc. Lecture isn't necessary and he just uses it to hear himself talk. Take this class with any one else.

Eeasiest class I will ever take at Ohio State. I went to 3 classes all year and managed to get a high A. There were 12 online quizzes 10 points each that you had 2 attempts at. you could use your notes too. Also 2 writings that took 10 minutes each and were graded very easily. No Midterm and if you get higher than 90% on quizzes then no final.

Brandon makes his lectures interesting. This class is not difficult, easy 1 page papers and weekly 10 question online quizzes. He rapped the Intro to the Iliad which was awesome. Overall, it's an easy class and Brandon makes it interesting. I would definitely take this class!

Brandon said from the start that he doesn't care about grades and only gives grades because he has to. There were no exams, the papers are 1 page max, all quizzes are 10 easy questions online, and classes are just discussion. I found him really easy to talk to and always helpful. Definitely recommend to take as a GE.

summary_comment: Professor Johnston is highly regarded for her engaging and informative lectures, which are enhanced with stories and sometimes movies to aid understanding. She emphasizes student learning over grades, offering supportive feedback on writing assignments and allowing retakes. Her classes are generally easy to navigate with clear expectations and minimal required reading, though attendance is crucial as it significantly impacts the grade.
summary_comment_short: Professor Johnston is highly regarded for her engaging and accessible teaching style, with interesting lectures and minimal stress due to her lenient grading and supportive approach. Her classes rely on attendance, note-taking, and short quizzes, making the coursework manageable and her passion for the subject matter evident.

Ratings.comment: Professor Johnston was my favorite professor I had this semester. Attendance wasn't mandatory and she post class note outlines for every class. There was no textbook, she provided PDFs of everything she wanted us to read. Quizzes were lecture content and were substituted for class to make sure students had time to complete the quiz.

Proffesor Johnston gave interesting lectures and I learned a ton without the stress of grades. There were several short writing assignments which she gave great feedback on and even let you rewrite and be re-graded. The two "midterms" were very reasonable short multiple choice quizzes, she doesn't try to trick you. Highly recommend this class!

The class consists of going to lecture to take notes and then there's multiple writing assignments. The writing assignments are small though and fairly easy to write. There were only two "exams" and they were both multiple choice. I highly recommend taking this class. Professor Johnston is also very funny and truly cares for her students!
Lectures with stories so you remember them better. As long as you show up and put any percent of effort into listening you'll do well. Quizzes are easy and not too specific.

Super easy class, I got a 99.75%. If you show up to lecture and pay attention (maybe take a sentence or two of notes), the quizzes are 100's. Her grading consisted of a quiz at the end of each week, a midterm, and a final. No writing, minimal reading despite being a literature course.

The class was graded based on 5 quizzes and a final. All the quizzes seemed to be a little difficult, but doable. Attendance is required and made up something like 30% of the grade, so if you take this class you better plan on attending. The lectures are very interesting if you like magic or witchcraft and the course content is very solid.

Professor Iles-Johnston was extremely knowledgable in her field and was able to answer even the most specific hypotheticals. She is clearly passionate about her subjects (I took her Witchcraft class) and uses that passion to engage students. very easy to talk to, very quirky woman. I would definitely take another class of her's!

This class was interesting, and there were a couple times where movies were shown during lecture. You take notes every lecture from an outline that she posts on Carmen. Be sure to pay attention during lecture to take good notes so that you can prepare well for quizzes and the final.
Really funny, informative, easy quizzes, showing up matters.

My favorite professor hands down. Sit in the front row. Participate. If you like listening to stories you will love this class. Johnston is a wonderful caring professor (which is rare). Put in some effort for the papers and reread your notes for quizzes. I finished with an 104% in the class. Do not skip class though, you might get behind!

Great professor and incredibly easy class. 4 short quizzes, 3 short papers, and attendance are only grades. No reason not to receive an A as long as you go to class. Definitely cares about her students and the subject. Would recommend to anyone.

Super interesting class! 10% attendance and 90% is distributed between 5 quizzes, so there's no final which is sweet! Not super hard, DO NOT BUY THE BOOK it's not worth it. Very lecture heavy, she gives outlines of notes but adds a lot more in class so you have to pay attention. If you go to lecture and do the notes it's a pretty easy A!

Professor Johnston has honestly been one of my favorite professors at OSU. She did a fantastic job of summarizing our readings and always kept the class engaged and interested. I took her class to satisfy a GE and it was very straightforward; the final grade consisted of 2 quizzes (20% each), attendance (15%) and a final paper (45%). Easy A.

This class was interesting and the professor worked hard to keep everyone engaged with pictures, movie clips and anecdotes along with the lecture. You can read the textbook, I never did and still got As on all the quizzes. Graded only on multiple choice quizzes and a multiple choice final. Attendance is taken and graded, so show up.

Dr. Johnston was a great professor.  While lectures could be boring she kept them interesting.  If you go to every class and pay attention the class is an Easy "A".  The class consist of 5 quizzes and 1 final.  There is no homework except for reading.

She's very friendly and teaches with a lot of enthusiasm.  The only reason I didn't like this class is because there are 5 quizzes (lowest dropped), attendance, and the final. The quizzes and final only has 20 questions, so it's pretty easy to kind of poorly in the class.

She is honestly the best professor in all the classes I have ever taken here for the past 3 years. She is clear and goes in details on everything. Read the materials she gives and you will have no problem. I would take her class all over again!

Such an easy GEC. Took notes through an outline she put on Carmen and quizzes were based off of that. Each quiz was 20 questions and the lowest dropped and the final was 20 questions basically full of questions off of the old quizzes. Very interesting class. Watched a movie and very clear and helpful if you had questions.

I thoroughly enjoyed the class. Professor Johnston clearly enjoyed what she was teaching, and we took notes via outline form, which I found very easy. If you pay attention, the class is very interesting and easy!
she worked for history channel. she knows the subject
She's very interesting and an expert in her field. She's funny, charming and just fun to listen to.
She's super nice and super funny. 4 quizzes and a really easy essay for midterm and final. Easy A.
Amazing Professor. She really knew what she was talking about and really liked to help. 10 quizes and a final paper. Super easy.

Johnston was very helpful by thoroughly explaining the course contain each day of lecture. The quizzes were not difficult as long as you listened during lecture and read the provided outline each day.

She was always prepared and sprightly. She seemed like she loved her job and loved undergrads. Her assignments were interesting and easy to complete, and her story-telling abilities are spectacular. The class was not as much fun as I had hoped it would be--but I still got a lot out of it.
Johnston is a great teacher who is very clear about her expectations. Her lectures are clear and organized and she is very knowledgeable about the subject matter.

Easy class! If you need a GEC, definetly take this one with sarah! It's like storytime everytime, and she keeps it interesting! Only 5 quizes, drops lowest one..my lowest was only 27/30.  If you go to class and listen, you'll know the answers to the quizes!! Don't need to read either, as long as you don't skip class, your fine!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

I enjoyed her lecture. It was a very intresting class. If you go to lecture you just need to review her notes when you study. She gave a lot of cool information. Her quizzes were multiple choice and if you study some then they are easy! I enjoyed the material she covered, she kept the class interesting.

She's a wonderful teacher.  She kept class pretty interesting, and the outlines she put online before class were very helpful.  Tests and final were very easy multiple choice.  I actually looked forward to going to class - it was like storytime!  Definitely recommended.

I've taken three classes with her, Classics 222, Greek Religion and an MRS class, Witchcraft and Magic in the Middle Ages.  I can highly recommend any class by her.  I got A's in all but the last class, and that was because I slacked that quarter. And, not only did I get good grades, I learned a lot of interesting stuff.  Don't slack, go to lecture

Very easy, fun class. Books aren't really necessary but can be fun to read if you're into Greek myth. Listening to a story or two every day and remembering who did what isn't very hard if you try. I especially liked her style of giving outlines ahead of time, that way you don't struggle to keep up.
GREAT PROF! Very interesting teaching methods, kept class very lively.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Kept most of the lectures interesting - it was more like hearing a story everyday. Don't buy the books though, I spent $108 bucks and only read them the first week. Went to lectures and took notes and had an A- (missed an A by 2 pts.)
Really easy class, only based on 150 points, keeps lectures lively and interesting.

SEI.Subject: MEDREN
SEI.Class Name: Magic and Witchcraft in the Middle Ages and Renaissance

summary_comment: Professor Nelson-Hawkins is known for her engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, which helps students appreciate the subject matter, particularly evident in her Latin classes. Her classes are generally considered easy with fair exams and quizzes, and she is described as very understanding and supportive of students' needs. However, some students find her lectures unorganized and overly detailed, and criticize her tendency to make anachronistic comparisons and incorporate personal political views into the curriculum.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nelson-Hawkins is known for her engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, which helps students appreciate the subject matter, particularly evident in her class on Ovid's Metamorphoses. Her classes can be quite detailed and sometimes lengthy, but she is described as very understanding and caring, making the course accessible even for students from other majors.

Ratings.comment: Such an interesting class. Every day I learned something new!! Didn't take too much time to do the work either. There were discussion boards and small open-note weekly quizzes, but it really wasn't bad. She genuinely cares about our success and I highly recommend the class.

Prof. Hawkins clearly loves what she teaches and that enthusiasm definitely gave me a new appreciation for Ovid's Metamorphoses. I would highly recommend taking a Latin class with her. She is very understanding in terms of absences, but be ready to translate and put in the work during classes!
Classes are pretty boring unless you're really into the material. Fairly easy exams and quizzes.

Professor Hawkins does her best to make course material for kids in other majors, this results in terribly anachronistic comparisons of the ancient romans to the modern day. Class is like attending the Democratic National Convention-Donald Trump was mentioned in every single class, an incredible feat noting that he was not alive during Ancient Rome

The first 9 weeks covers basically nothing but hearsay that she will say is supported by "sources," though none can be found. Second half is a bit more substantiated, but it is hard to get over the infused ideology ever-present. She loves to cover how much she hates republicans. Don't speak up if you have different political beliefs.
Exams are open notes. One paper towards the end. Super kind and caring. Two discussions per week and a quiz at the end of the week. Really easy A. Take this class!

Class was relatively easy. I showed up to every lecture and thats all I needed to do to get a 90% on the midterm and final. Professor is very well versed on the topic but often goes into too much detail. There are readings but I never did them because she talks about the main points in class. Overall solid GE and I took away more than I expected.

Shes pretty unorganized as far as a syllabus, using Carmen, and rubric criteria. You get graded on a few quizzes, a midterm, a final, and a term paper. The class is easy if you can endure the long lectures that, again, are not super organized. If you can know the key terms and find the important information in the crazy slides youll be ok.

If you're interested in the subject, I'm sure she's great. if you're just there for an easy A, lectures are boring as can be but just show up and take good notes and you will be ready for exams which aren't too difficult.

She is one of the nicest professors I have ever had, and you can tell she loves the subject, but I did find the material quite boring. I can see how some people would be very interested in it though.  Everything is fairly easy, and she provides lots of EC, but it was very lecture heavy, and her powerpoint were all over the place.

Dr. Hawkins is a fantastic lecturer. I truly  am enjoying this intro Roman Civ class. Dr. Hawkins is truly enjoyable to listen to, she LOVES questions, and is very passionate about her material. Attendence is taken daily and does count. Quizzes every Friday but are super easy if you just follow the lecture. Would definitely take again!!

one of the most passionate professors i have had, however she is all over the place with her teaching and although she was interested in the class i found it hard to pay attention or care about what i was learning. exams weren't too bad but there weren't many grades for wiggle room.
Easy GE. Loves discussion, cool professor.
She is a little all over the place when she teaches, but if you listen to her you will get an easy A in the class. You don't even have to read. Just show up and listen.

I think Julia did a good job. People need to chill because she brought her kids to class when they didn't have school and her husband was at work. She's an amazing teacher and very helpful. Just pay attention and read and you'll be fine. The topics were very interesting and the tests/essays were fairly easy if you knew the material.

I learned so much in this class and I had no idea ancient medicine had so much to do with modern medicine.  I now am thinking about minoring in the medical humanities minor!  I hope the other classes in the minor are this interesting
Great Class; topics focus on the big picture. Helpful in preparing for med-school interviews!

would recommend this class to anyone looking for an easy A.  I dont own the book and dont pay attention during lecture but it is fairly easy material.  Hawkins does take some time to grade, but that is because she is mainly doing the load of the grading herself.  Very approachable and passionate.

Would not recommend this class. The material is somewhat interesting if you get into it, but since this is just a GE, I wasn't very into it. She brings her kids to class sometimes and takes forever to get grades back. Does cancel classes and quizzes sometimes. If you go to class, which is part of your grade, you won't have to do much reading.

I would not recommend this class. She brought her children to class 3 times so far this semester. One time was during our exam and she kept clapping at the kids to be quiet at the front of the room, which was very distracting. Three weeks after the exam, which is 35% of your overall grade, we do not have our grades posted. Confusing lectures.

Biggest waste of money if you want to learn something. Watched 9 movies in class that took the entire class lecture period, i could have stayed home and watched them all on netflix. Doesn't come prepared or know when her own exams are. Spent $100 on three text books and never used them once.

Julia is an excellent lecturer. I got an A and I didn't study at all for any of the exams because I remembered every word that she said during lecture, because it was all SO interesting. If you go to class regularly, you don't need to do the readings (she goes over them) and you'll do well. If you don't go, it'll be much harder to do well.

she assigns reading every night (never once opened the books..). pay attention to key points, it's self explanatory. takes attendance every day but only 5% of grade. every tues there would be a MC quiz over the previous 2 lecture's material.. very simple, with extra credit if you wrote extra info next to your answers. papers inclu. 4 midterm&final

I am an in education so this class was a stretch. The material is extremely interesting,so much better than I had anticipated. She is also normal and so nice, unlike what one might picture a classics teacher. She goes over most readings in lecture. Tests/quizzes are easy if you pay attention;Use study guide. I would recommend this class to anyone.

I absolutely LOVED this class! Prof H is absolutely an incredible professor. She makes the class enjoyable, while at the same time introducing concepts I had never thought of before. I thought the class was very relatable - I'm a pre-vet student and I learned new information that I will use in the future. I looked forward to class. Exams are fair

Prof H really made this class interesting. Every class period she had a new modern discovery tied into the topic discussed that day and made the class enjoyable to attend. Knows what she is teaching well and offers a TON of extra credit opportunities! Loved the class and highly recommend it.

She is awesome! Totally changed the way that I am approaching my plans for med school. So much makes so much more sense now. Anyone thinking of health sciences (or any science really) needs to take this class. Nelson-Hawkins is one of the absolute best!
Loved Professor Hawkins! This was a very informative class and she was also able to make it interesting. I truly believe she wanted us to do well in her class.

I took this class out of curiosity-beyond glad I did. As a seasoned medical professional I found this class not only fascinating on a classics literature/historical level but from medical perspective as well. Exceptional teaching/lecture material. HIGHLY recommend class/professor. I will certainly be pursuing further education in this department.

This class was a lot of fun. The instructor knew a lot about the material and kept the class interesting. She also found a way to incorporate watching 28 Days Later into the course, which was pretty awesome. Those criticizing her need to remember she is an expert in classics, not medicine, and she did a great job teaching a medicine based course.

The professor was very passionate and made me love the course. Also offered help, and wanted class participation. I felt other students really gave her a hard time, even when she asked to be corrected if she was wrong. It was really unfair to her. But I thought she really helped us to understand the material of the course, and wanted us to pass.

Repeatedly strayed out of the scope of the course and stated facts not in her field.  Some of what she said pertained to my area of study and was incorrect, which made me question what else she said was incorrect.

Easy class, Julia makes the class amazing. She made game of thrones references at least twice a week. Attendance of lectures is not mandatory though I recommend it. She explains the text well and makes class fun. My advice: read the books, it helps you with interpreting the texts for the final.
Easy fun and educational.  Classics course but don't remember what number it was. Strongly recommend.
The class was easy. Translation and discussion of the historical writings of authors. There is not much else to say.

summary_comment: Professor Harril is known for his rigorous and opinionated teaching style, which some students find challenging and frustrating. Tests are difficult, and grades are heavily influenced by the professor's personal views, making it nearly impossible to achieve top scores. While his depth of knowledge on religious topics is commendable, many students strongly advise against taking his course due to its demanding nature and subjective grading.
summary_comment_short: Professor Harril is known for his challenging and opinion-driven teaching style, which many students find difficult and discouraging, leading to low grades and a negative learning experience. Despite some students acknowledging his deep knowledge of religious texts, the overall consensus is that his classes are tough and not recommended due to his strict grading and unhelpful responses to questions.

Ratings.comment: This Professor is the worst I have ever taken. This class ruined my entire semester. Impossible to answer any question correctly because he has very strong and specific opinions. If you write about anything he doesn't agree with, will get a bad grade. No one in the class got a 100 on any test. Took a 2000-level class and he taught like it was 6000.
It is a difficult class. The TA that I had was helpful,. Two papers and two exams. Hard grader.

Harril's knowledge over religionChristianity is impressive. He knows everything about the bible and other historic pieces of literature. His classes are hard but if you want to learn about religion..I recommend him as a teacher.

Tests were pretty okay. Papers are graded incredibly rough. Papers are graded on his opinions. If you are a Christian, this class challenges your faith a lot. I would highly recommend to anyone to not take this course. The professor contradicts himself and refuses to answer challenging questions. Hated the course in all aspects.

summary_comment: Professor Parks is known for his passion and humor in teaching, making the material accessible through straightforward lectures and assignments. While the course content and assessments are generally easy and closely aligned with the provided materials, there have been instances where lecture and assignment releases were inconsistent, though deadlines were often adjusted to accommodate students. His flexibility is appreciated, especially in accommodating personal emergencies, though some students have noted a lack of compassion in handling such situations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Parks is known for his clear passion and humor in lecturing, making the material accessible through straightforward assignments and PowerPoint-based questions on exams. While students appreciate his flexibility with deadlines and his knowledge, some have noted inconsistency in the timing of lecture and assignment releases, though this did not significantly impact their ability to complete coursework.

Ratings.comment: Collin was a clearly passionate and funny lecturer. Assignments were simple and easy to follow. I wish the course was a bit more consistent in terms of when things were released, but there was always enough time to watch the lectures and take the quizzes.

Class was very easy. Almost every question on every exam and quiz came right off the power point and there was more than enough time to look at the slides to get good grades on the assignment. Prof Parks was very flexible with me as I dealt with being hospitalized and couldn't deal with course work for weeks. Overall a great course.

The class itself was straight forward and pretty easy however, I had a family situation occur and he was not accommodating nor compassionate about what was happening. I had to fly out to LA to see my brother in the hospital and he responded that he hoped my friend felt better and to complete the assignment by the end of the week.

Class was very easy and pretty straight forward. Almost every question from quizzes or exams were pulled directly from the lecture slides he posted. Lectures and assignments sometimes came up late but the deadlines were always adjusted to accommodate any changes. Easy A

Very knowledgeable and passionate about the topic and includes some jokes in his lectures to keep things interesting, which is great. All of the quizzes and exams were very easy and straight from the presentations. Lectures and assignments were often uploaded late, but he usually moved deadlines to accommodate for that.

summary_comment: Professor Fertik is highly energetic and passionate about her subject, making her lectures engaging despite occasional dull moments. She assigns significant reading material, though it is not strictly necessary for exam success. Her exams are manageable, and she grades leniently on short papers, making the class relatively easy with consistent attendance and attention.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fertik is highly energetic and passionate about her subject, making her lectures engaging despite occasional dull moments. Her classes require consistent attendance and note-taking, as the material covered in lectures is crucial, though some extra reading and assignments are beneficial for deeper understanding.

Ratings.comment: Fertik brings a lot of energy to her lectures, and you can tell she enjoys what she teaches. There was a good amount of reading outside of class (2 books), but it isn't extremely important, just make sure you attend lectures and take notes. The class can sometimes be boring, but it's an easy A if you just pay attention and attend.

Super passionate professor which was quite refreshing. She does assign a lot of reading but you don't necessarily need to do it. Just show up to lecture and pay attention and you'll do fine on her exams. She also assigned three short papers as well, which she graded very leniently.

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Classics and African American Political Thought

summary_comment: Professor But is widely regarded as an excellent and easy instructor, known for making the class manageable and straightforward. Students appreciate her clear expectations and supportive approach, including multiple attempts for quizzes and detailed guidance on test responses. While some suggest paying attention in class for optimal performance, the overall consensus is that the course is very easy and suitable for those looking to fulfill a general education requirement with minimal effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor But is widely regarded as an excellent and easy instructor, known for making the class accessible with clear expectations and multiple opportunities for success, such as retakes and detailed study guides. Students find the course manageable and recommend it for those looking to fulfill a general education requirement with minimal effort.

Ratings.comment: My favorite professor!
My favorate Professor!

This class in unbelievably easy. You don't even have to do the readings in order to succeed in this class. And for each quiz, you get two attempts. She is very clear with how she wants you to answer the written response questions for the tests and gives examples. Very easy A.

The course was pretty easy. There was one 10 pt quiz every week and then a test every 5 weeks. It's mostly multiple choice with a few written response on the test but she is very direct with what she wants for the written response.

Great professor. I would highly recommend you take this class. Only advice would be to pay attention in class. Exams are not really hard. Write your essays before the deadline and send it to the TA, so you can maximize your grade.
Easiest online class I've taken at OSU. If you want an easy GE and are at least mildly interested in Greek mythology, take this one.

I took this online class for a GE requirement and it was very manageable. There are weekly lectures, readings, and quizzes(open note). I never did any of the readings and did just fine. Each test has 28 questions from previous quizzes(mult-choice), and 4 written questions(5-10 sentences). Study guide for each test and the final is NOT cumulative!!!
Pretty good professor. class was easy with a quiz every week and 3 tests. The only annoying thing is each quiz and test require a password  and you have to watch the lectures in order to get them.

Online lectures each week for 2 hrs. Some outside reading. Keep an outline of what you read and obtain summaries for each. Typed notes helped with recalling for weekly open note quizzes. Study for the exams by making quizlet notecards from the quizzes and reviewing the tests.
Dr. But is incredibly knowledgeable in her field. She makes thoughtful connections outside the course material and provides a great learning experience.

summary_comment: Professor Acosta-Hughes is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous lectures, which students find both entertaining and informative. Despite being frequently late, he maintains a friendly and understanding demeanor, earning him positive reviews for his overall teaching quality. Students recommend taking his classes for an easy and enjoyable learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Acosta-Hughes is known for his highly engaging and humorous lectures, which students find both entertaining and informative. He is praised for his understanding and honesty, making him a popular and easy-going professor among students.

Ratings.comment: FIREEE FITS!!!!!! If I'm being completely honest, his lectures were incredibly funny, and to continue with the honesty, this man was always late to lecture. Not that I minded, but it was just hilarious how he was always late. He's incredibly understanding and honest with his students. He's a nice professor. Take him if you can!!!!!! Easy A (:

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Topics in Ancient Literature and Culture

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Classical Literature: Theoretical Perspectives and Critical Readings

SEI.Subject: CLAS
SEI.Class Name: Topics in Ancient Literature and Culture

SEI.Subject: GREEK
SEI.Class Name: Graduate Seminar on Greek Literature and Culture

summary_comment: Professor Caliva is known for her passionate and enthusiastic teaching style, particularly in her lectures on classics. However, her class requires significant time commitment, including mandatory attendance and participation, as well as extensive reading. Students generally appreciate her supportive demeanor outside of class but warn that the course demands substantial effort to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Caliva is an enthusiastic and passionate lecturer who excels in conveying her knowledge with clarity and humor. However, her class requires significant time commitment, including mandatory participation and random quizzes, making it challenging for students looking for an easy general education course.

Ratings.comment: Personally, I didn't vibe with the way Professor Caliva teaches. She's a kind person & was understanding and supportive every time I reached out, but I just didn't vibe with the class. Don't have the character space to get into the specifics here. Participation in class discussions is mandatory. Carve out a large chunk of time for the reading.

She doesnt grade anything but quizzes, character sheets, participation, and the end-of-course project. That may sound like a bit, but if you read the material, the first three things I mentioned will be second nature. My project was a retelling of a myth, and I literally made a Twitter account. If you do the right thing, youll learn a lot. 9.5/10

Dr. Kathryn Caliva is an amazing lecturer. Her passion for classics really shines through her teaching. The class is very reading heavy and there are discussions once a week. It seems as if she grades based on how much you participate in class rather than the actual merit of your papers. Your final grade will be what she thinks you deserve.
She is great! Very enthusiastic about explaining the reading materials. As long as you read the books for the class you are fine!

This class was rated one of the easiest GEs on campus and Im sure it would have been if I I didnt have Kathryn caliva. This class is all the way on ag campus at 7pm with random quizzes and attendance which she will not excuse for midterms at the same time because we chose to take the night class. A lot of reading and hard midterms. DO NOT TAKE.

Dr. Caliva is a gem. She is articulate and conveys material clearly and with enthusiasm. Her love of mythology shines through, and she has a good sense of humor. Make sure to do the reading and attend lecture, she takes attendance for a grade on random days. Highly recommend for anything she teaches, I would take her again for any class.

She's really nice/passionate about the class but if you are taking this as an easy ge DO NO TAKE IT WITH HER. You have to read the book. Attendance is taken and there are pop quizzes. The tests are pretty hard because it's a lot of content and reviews a good amount of studying to do well. All other classics teachers are an easy A except her.
Amazing class and teacher. This is my favorite class in my college career.
So nice. Will do whatever she legally can to get you an A in the class. Very nice and loves what she teaches.

Queen. Easy class, don't read the textbook, just show up to lecture and pay attention. Also, she takes random attendance on tophat so go to every lecture. Study for the exams using the study guides and lecture slides. Mom.
honestly no, you will regret so much if you take it, but if you are really interested in mythology, take her, she is great, but if you are looking for an easy class, take it with other professors.

This is ridiculous. I heard Class 2220 was easy, but it definitely isn't WITH HER. We took our first exam a few weeks ago and it still isn't graded. It was honestly harder than any test I've ever taken. It's unfair the other Class 2220 classes aren't this serious. I'm waiting to get my exam back to take the W.

Do not take this class with Caliva. Class 2220 should not be this difficult considering this is a gen ed. For one, this class is in Kottman hall ACROSS THE RIVER. So that is very far. Second, she takes random attendance and random unannounced quizzes. Third, tests make up 75% of your grade. Fourth, an immense amount of reading is required.

summary_comment: Professor Kayes is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making classes enjoyable and stress-free. Students appreciate his thorough knowledge of the subject and his commitment to helping them truly understand the material rather than just memorize it. While some find his classes easy with minimal homework, others note the importance of attending daily to keep up with his unique teaching methods.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kayes is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making class enjoyable and stress-free. Students appreciate his thorough knowledge of the subject and his commitment to ensuring understanding over rote memorization, though some note that his lack of frequent tests and homework can make retention challenging.

Ratings.comment: Jason's class is really easy if you just show up. He knows his material and does a good job of teaching it to his students. He had us do worksheets in class everyday that were not for credit, just practice. We had 4 tests, no big exams or quizzes. His practice tests were the Friday before a test and were basically the same as the test.
Jason's class was so much fun, he's the type of prof that makes you want to go to class. 1102 with Jason has been my favorite class at OSU.
Super amazing. Wish he would've been who taught my other latin classes. Stress free and easy learning environment.

Jason is a linguistic and pedagogical maverick. He's humble, but really, he's the magister optimus. Highly thoughtful in his teaching practices. Will expect you to be in class every day. Often goes on philosophical or political tangents. Has a great sense of humor. Very patient but hates when people talk while he's talking. Definitely take him.
Great man, even better teacher. Very easy grader, knows his stuff. Highly recommend taking his courses. 10/10
Really Great. Actually cares that you learn and understand the material, not just memorize it. If you get the chance take the class with him!

Jason is an awesome professor and guy. His philosophy is interesting, and definitely unlike any other professor I've had at OSU. I would LOVE to have him again for 1103. The only thing is, the lack of tests and hw kept me from doing much studying, which made my next Latin class harder. If you can retain things well without much work, 100% take him.

Someone give this man a raise because he is awesome. Hilarious and has a very unique stress free teaching style. If you're the type who needs to be loaded with homework/quizzes to feel accomplished take someone else. Also don't skip class a lot and you'll be fine.

the best professor i have ever had in my entire life. he is really inspiring and thoughtful. easy A if you just show up to class but, if you are really interested in learning the material, his teaching method is the extremely beneficial for most students, in my opinion. definitely taking 1102 w/ him no matter the cost.

Professor Kayes is a fantastic teacher. He understands that tests almost always result in cramming and so he avoids them altogether. Only a short quiz every class that you should be able to ace if you even looked at the reading, which is never long. I would recommend this class to anyone with an interest in mythology.

Classics 3000 is by far one of the easiest most interesting classes I've taken at OSU. Jason is a genuine guy who only wants his students to learn and not stress out over tests and papers. I highly recommend to take a class tought by this instructor!

Jason is a great person, but his classroom management is subpar.  He gives a quiz every day, but they are too easy for a third-level Latin course.   He did not teach me anything that I had not learned in 1101.  If you want an easy "A" take his class, if you want to learn, take the course with someone else.

Dr. Kayes is amazing. Daily quizzes on the readings that are very general and not at all hard. No other grades besides attendance. All he wants is for students to show up and learn. Very interesting if you like the classics.  He is also incredibly nice and will bend over backwards to help you out with things like EC if you have a problem.

He only gives us 1 quiz at the beginning of each class, super general questions about the reading and previous day's lecture. 2 are dropped, and if disasters happen he'll offer extra cred to make up for other missed quizzesabsences. No papers, no midterms, no final. His focus is actually on the learning, not the evaluation. 1010 would take again.

Easiest A you will ever take. All you have to do for this class is show up and pay attention and an A is basically guaranteed. Weekly quizzes that are ridiculously easy and one paper that you can do corrections on. Jason is a great lecturer and actually allows you learn the material, plus classical mythology is a fun topic. Great prof, great class.

Jason is an easy professor. If you show up to class you will pass. However, I would recommend having a genuine interest in the classics and maybe Latin and Greek as well. He is passionate about his subject, but his all over the place lectures may be tough to follow for student who do not share his passion.
He is not concerned with grades and is only concerned with you showing up and paying attention to his lectures. Good class and good lecturer.
Awesome guy and teacher!
Great class to take if you are interested in learning about Greek and Roman literature.I gained an appreciation for ancient literature and don't find classical reads boring any more. easy A.

AMAZING professor! Definitely my favorite professor at OSU so far. He doesn't focus on grades, and although the course is an easy A you learn a ton. We focused a lot more on mythology then you would expect. No textbooks. Lectures always interesting and posts notes. Weekly quizzes and one paper, no final. Take any course you can with Kayes!!
Great professor. Definitely take his class if you are interested in learning about ancient Greek myth/lit/culture. Pay attention to lectures and you'll be set for the weekly quizzes.
great guy and teacher.  very helpful
Prof. Kayes is one of the best professors I have ever had, he is very clear and organized. He is not as interested in grades as full material comprehension. If you go to class it will be an easy A

He is an absolutely amazing professor and one of the easiest courses you will take. He doesn't focus on grades as much as actually learning about the Greek myths and stories. He doesn't use a textbook and just uses PDF files for readings. Not a lot of reading, and even if you don't read you will be fine. One of my all time favorite teachers at OSU.

summary_comment: Professor Lipp is highly passionate about his subject and makes classes engaging and relevant. His teaching style relies heavily on in-class participation and weekly quizzes, with no exams. Students find the class easy to pass with good note-taking, though some require additional reading for full understanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lipp is highly passionate about his subject and makes classes engaging and fun, though he relies heavily on in-class participation and note-taking. His grading is relatively lenient, with quizzes and a few short papers making up the majority of the grade, and he encourages attendance without providing extensive lecture materials.

Ratings.comment: He is very passionate about the topics he teaches. Very few graded assignments, so need to do well on the ones provided. He's super funny, and tries to make the content relatable to college students. Have to be in class in order to take notes, he doesn't have any provided or guided notes. It's a fun GE class, i would recommend.

Professor Lipp made class interesting every day. Questions on the quiz come straight from lectures, so made sure you are paying attention and taking good notes. There were three small papers throughout the semester.

Professor Lipp is incredible, he is super passionate about what he does and an easy grader. There is a bit of reading, somewhat difficult to understand which is to be expected for the type of literature you are required to read, but if you attend class you'll receive an easy A. Highly recommend.

Dr Lipp is highly passionate about his work and it comes through in his lectures.  Weekly quizzes that relate to the weekly readings and lectures.  3 Papers throughout semester  Great class, fun subject matter, and made better by a professor who wants you to enjoy what you are doing

Dr. Lipp explains the readings so well in lectures that you probably don't even have to read outside of class. If you take good notes, then you can do well on the weekly quizzes. These weekly quizzes are worth a huge bulk of your grade and the lowest quiz grade is dropped. These quizzes plus 3 one-page papers make up your total grade. No exams.
Easy class! Show up to lectures and take descent notes.

Dr. Lipp is so passionate about what he teaches and he teaches it very well. The material is very clear, lots of reading, but can easily pass all quizzes using just the notes taken in class (I hardly read anything). This is a super easy GE class and I would recommend this prof/class to anyone.

Dr. Lipp is seriously the best professor I have ever had. You get a 10 question quiz based off of lectures every week, and then a one page essay every other week. All of this is online, so you are encouraged to use notes. No exams! Super easy. Just go to lectures and you'll pass no problem. Super great guy. Take his course. You won't regret it!

Dr. Lipp is easily the best professor I've ever had even if it's a GE I didn't have much interest in. He really cares about the students and is more interested in teaching students than grades. If you go to class and take good notes, you will easily get an A.
good guy
Easy (pointless) GE class. But this guy expects you to not use technology in the room while he's sitting on Google Docs typing a presentation. Not to mention on 8 pt font so you can't read anything.
Really great lectures. Also, super friendly and willing to help outside of class. I would definitely take a class with him again.

He went over everything in the readings so well that you hardly need to read the assigned readings, but get the books for reference. 12 quizzes, but only 10 count and 4 1-page essays, but only 3 count. NO EXAMS! He posts slides online, but they are only brief bullet points so you MUST come to class and take good notes and you will easily pass.

summary_comment: Professor Batstone is highly knowledgeable and passionate about his subject, effectively conveying a wealth of information to his students. While his classes can be disorganized and may include tangents, he is exceptionally supportive outside of class and offers generous grading policies. Students find him challenging yet rewarding, though some note his tendency to nitpick and potentially overwhelm emotionally sensitive individuals.
summary_comment_short: Professor Batstone is highly knowledgeable and passionate about his subject, effectively conveying a wealth of information but occasionally struggling with organization and clarity. Despite some tangents and distractions, students find him extremely helpful and willing to support their learning, often going above and beyond traditional grading expectations.

Ratings.comment: Although he does have high expectations, he is a very passionate professor who is genuinely interested in the learning of students. The class I had with him was a little disorganized however he was very good with answering questions outside of class. Can occasionally go off on tangents but all history professors do that.

AMAZING. Really knows what he's talking about, and extremely helpful. More worried about helping than grading. Even let us retake all our quizzes. If you got an A on the final you got an A in the class no matter what your average.

I really liked him.  He was a bit random, but that kekpt things interesting.  He really knows a lot about ancient rome and greece as well as the writers in it.  I learned a lot as well as getting a good grade, he's awesome.
He gets distracted a lot, but you learn A LOT from him.  He knows a lot of stuff, but he's sometimes not very clear.  He takes this into consideration though, and offers decent grades

He's very knowledgable, and that's obvious. You will learn things from the class whether you like it or not. He's really bad with group discussions, though -- much more suited to lectures. Be prepared to have the most unhelpful Powerpoint slides EVER, though.
Class had three grades- take home midterm, take home final (partially), and a paper.  He was very excited about the course, and class discussions were good (but sometimes dragged on).

Brilliant, knowledgeable, and arguably one of the best Latinists I've come across to date. However, he does tend to nitpick and jump down your throat a lot... Not for the emotionally fragile or the easily frightened... which I tend to be. Keep quiet and out of notice, and you'll learn a lot, though.
Take his courses only if you are bright, motivated, and don't mind being randomly savaged once in a while.

summary_comment: Professor Erlinger is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics accessible and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his deep knowledge of mythology and his ability to foster a stress-free learning environment through thought-provoking discussions and minimal high-stakes assessments. His courses are noted for their manageable workload, with easy quizzes and fair grading, though they do require consistent attendance and some significant reading.
summary_comment_short: Professor Erlinger is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics accessible and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his extensive knowledge, laid-back approach, and fair grading standards, noting that the course workload, while substantial, is manageable with attentive participation and study.

Ratings.comment: This class seems much harder than it actually is, Chris is hilarious and one of the smartest professors I have ever had. Definitely get to know him and I would recommend this course for anyone.

Best teacher I've ever had, college or not. Special blend of extremely-laid back while still teaching students in a stress-free environment. It really just felt like we were there to have thought-provoking discussions about mythology without the necessity of overbearing written assignments or exams. Would take any random class to have him again.

Chris is the most knowledgeable yet relaxed professor I have met. It seems like he knows everything about Mythology, even answering the most obscure questions in lecture. There is one paper in class and pretty much everyone who turns it in gets an A. The quizzes are easy and you can drop 3. Exams are a cakewalk if you pay attention in lecture.
Chris is a very knowledgeable and entertaining lecturer. He is also a fair grader and one of the most chill lecturers I have ever had. However, he does assign quite a bit of reading.

Chris is one of the most chill professors I have had at OSU. He takes a lot of material and presents it in ways that are easy to understand. There is a lot of reading, but he uploads them all to Carmen (no textbook). 9 EASY pop quizzes that force you to go to class, but 4 of them are dropped. Great guy with a great sense of humor! Loved this class.

Such an awesome guy. There's a lot of information to cover but he makes it entertaining and appealing for the students. He gives very easy quizzes and even drop the four worst quizzes out of all 9. As long as you show up to lectures and listen well and study for midterms, it's an easy A. Love this guy

There's an easy pop quiz once a week (if you do the reading you'll be fine, students ask the questions). No homework except the readings, an bibliography/evidence sheet, and two essays (no final exam, just the essay). The first essay is short (5-6 pages) and the second is long (10-11) but the second can be an expansion of the first.

summary_comment: Professor Hawkins is generally viewed as a caring and passionate instructor who genuinely wants his students to succeed. However, his lectures can be somewhat dry and are often better suited for online quizzes rather than comprehensive understanding. While the class structure allows for flexibility and some leniency in grading (with dropped papers and a focus on quizzes), the material can still be challenging, particularly the final exam, which carries significant weight.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hawkins is a dedicated educator who genuinely cares about his students' success, although his lectures can be somewhat boring. His classes are generally fair and manageable, with a focus on weekly quizzes and a few papers, but the final exam can be unexpectedly challenging despite the overall fairness of the grading.

Ratings.comment: Meh. He tries his best to make the material interesting, but its just so boring. Maybe Im just not into this subject, but this was NOT the easy A class everyone made it out to be. Tests and quizzes were difficult and hard to prepare for. Would I take it again? Probably not. Was it the worst class ever? Nah. Nice guy overall.

Would have gotten an A but even though the weekly quizzes are easy and the midterm was super easy, the final is deceptively hard. I didnt go to that class almost the entire semester. All assignments are online and out of class. He doesnt say anything in lecture that isnt on the slides-which he uploads to carmen.

The man truly does care for his students and he goes out of his way to make sure everyone has what they need to succeed. His lectures are really easy to follow and the exams aren't difficult either (lot of multiple choice). If I could take more of his classes I would

The class is not easy. That being said if you can put in time you will get a good grade. Lowest paper and midterm is dropped. The professor is a great person who is passionate about his work. If you are interested in the material, you will be fine, but if you're looking for an easy GE keep searching.

The final exam is worth 50% of your grade. He asks very detailed questions that are easy to miss even if you read. There are extra credit opportunities but happen to all be during other classes of mine. Lecture is boring and very hard to realize the important details to take notes on. Would NOT recommend if looking for an easy GE.

Professor Hawkins truly cares about his students. He's a great guy. His lectures can be a bit boring but helpful for the weekly quizzes. Overall the class is fair, if not a tad too easy. A decent gen ed.
Having this teacher is the best decision you will ever make.

Hawkins was a great professor that was very passionate about what he teaches. You aren't graded on much. Quizzes online with unlimited attempts every week. Three Papers are graded by TA's and are graded easily. Midterm and final are based off quizzes so study those and you should do fine. Lectures are interesting but not mandatory. Read to get A.
One of the most inspiring professors I've had at OSU.  He connects the past with the present in a way that makes you see how history matters.

This class is super challenging for a GE. His tests ask so many minute details that even if you spend the 3-5 hours a week reading the plays and myths you could miss them. His lectures are incredibly boring and taking notes is pretty difficult as you have no idea what's important. If you like classics go for it, if not find another class.
Gets up there and blabs about so much information it is impossible to keep track of then asks about the most minute details on the tests
Easy class if you read. no need to participate in class, lets you have 4 skips without penalty

My favorite class I've taken at OSU, easily. You have to read a lot and write a couple papers, but as long as you do that and attend lecture, you'll get an A. Tom makes the already-interesting material (mythology) that much more interesting and understandable. I was actually excited to come to this class.

I was nervous coming into this class because of his reviews but he is the COMPLETE opposite of them. As long as you try to keep up with the readings you'll be fine. the exams are fair and the papers and quizzes help pad your grade. I recommend this class for an easy GEC. Class is not mandatory but I went and did none of the readings and got an A.

Lots of reading is required, bus as long as you read and take notes during lecture, the class isn't impossible. Tom is very passionate about his field and always comes prepared. He is very smart and seems to have fun lecturing about a subject that many find boring. I learned a lot, and Classics 2220 (mythology) has become my favorite class.
Always went to lecture but have no clue why. This guy is weird and rambles himself into a stagger. Half the time I get here and wish I would have left. Lecture is useless but DO THE READINGS.

Horrible professor. Rambles on about the books and puts up power points that don't make any sense. Midterm and final exams are impossible even if you go to class and do the reading. Asks the littlest details about the books. Doesn't care about his students and seems very arrogant. Most miserable class I've taken yet.

acts as if the whole class is full of mythology majors. don't take it if you're looking for a literature. most work i've ever put into a GEC. half of the test questions are not in the book and not in lecture notes, nor does he come out and actually talk about the questions, they are more of an implied sort that he assumes you will infer on your own

Worst class i've ever taken. Tries to make it harder than it is. Impossible midterm, questions come out of nowhere even after attending lecture and reading. Refuses to make any kind of study guide, instead assumes you should know it.
for a GEC, not worth it. i don't know where the test questions came from
Ridciulous amount of reading for such a laughably easy class. What a waste of time. He is obviously a feminist and lectures are boring beyond belief. Tries to make the class harder than it really is.
This class is interesting and I recommend it. Quizzes and exams are simple. Listen to interpretations in class and READ THE BOOKS. That's all that is needed to pass.

Just read the translations of all the works, they don't have to be the recommended ones. Sparknotes are helpful if you need it. It's easy to understand, and the questions on the recitation quizzes are basic and use stuff from lecture notes. Definitely attend lectures because the questions that trip students up on the exams aren't just summary q's.

Do not take this class. Tried to make the class "intellectual" but instead he made it too hard. The final was impossible. I went to almost every lecture, read all of the books, and still got a c in the class because of the final. not worth it.
Lectures were pretty much useless, quizzes were stupid easy, midterm was eh, final was super hard.

An absolute rockstar when it comes to Greek.  Expansive knowledge of "non-canonical" authors, superb command of the language - all around outstanding.  Couldn't have asked for a better Greek teacher for prose survey.
Everything you taught about Greek was kind of wrong.  No linguistic knowledge of language.

my favorite class the whole of my freshman year.  he's very good-humored and keeps the lectures interesting.  he knows his material and you can tell that he loves teaching it.  he posts the powerpoints on line but it helps more if you go to class.  a lot of reading, but if you listen, you have that much trouble
Awesome!  Was very enthusiastic.  A lot of reading, but the readings are interesting so i didn't mind.  Always helpful.  Easy quizzes and midterms.  Can tell he really loves what he does.
make sure you read.   if you don't read you won't get an A.   tests are very, very detailed.   assigns a lot of readings.  make sure you read.
Hawkins is a good professor...do the readings and make it to most of the lectures and itll be an easy A

Nice guy but nice doesnt always mean easy.  Lots and Lots of reading is required for his class and the weekly quizzes are extremely detailed!  Midterm and final were of average difficulty, there was nothing on there that i would consider unfair but once again they are extremely detailed.  Would not recommend this class, cause of readings
make sure you read everything because you will be tested on everything.   i thought he assigned too much reading some weeks. MAKE SURE YOU READ.

Over-all this was a pretty easy class. Professor Hawkins tries to make the lectures as interesting as possible. Attending the lecture isn't mandatory as long as you remember to keep up with the readings. Also the exams are not cumulative, so thats good.
Always helpful.  Grades papers very hard, but helps you to write better ones.  Tests were easy, one of my favorite teachers ever at OSU.
No Comments
Love that guy

He grades VERY HARD on papers. I've never gotten below an A on a paper, but he gave me a C+. However, his class is really fun and interesting, and he's a great teacher. The midterm was pretty easy if you paid attention in class. Beware of his paper gradings, though. They were totally fair, but very, very difficult. He lets nothing slide.

summary_comment: Professor Wenzel is highly regarded for his clear and engaging lectures, which transform potentially dry material into an enjoyable learning experience. Students find his classes accessible and appreciate his commitment to making the subject matter interesting and relevant. While the labs are noted to be less engaging, attendance is crucial due to the difficulty of make-up sessions. Overall, Professor Wenzel is seen as a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who facilitates a successful learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wenzel is highly regarded for his clear lectures and engaging teaching style, which made the material more enjoyable and accessible. Students found his exams challenging but manageable with adequate preparation, and appreciated his laid-back approach to the course.

Ratings.comment: He was a great teacher that I actually really learned from. I wasn't a fan of the material,but he made the lectures really enjoyable. The tests were not bad at all and I probably overstudied for them and did well. The labs weren't the greatest, but try not to miss lab because the make-up labs take forever and you have to do them without your group.

No textbook required. He posts the lectures online so honestly you could get by staying at home, except for the days we have case studies with people from our lab session. I didn't mind going to the lectures, he makes them quite clear for all 200+ people you'll take the class with. Just do the work and study a little for the exams.

The class was more work than I expected coming in, but not too bad. There are 3 article reflections, a career/scientific method paper, and an evolution paper. None were very hard.
