There are also 2 exams and a non cumulative final. Wenzel's lectures are actually interesting and sometimes funny. Just come to lecture and lab, study, and you'll do fine

Professor Wenzel's lectures were very clear. There were also 3 Article reflection papers, a career paper, and a book report type paper. If you pay attention, take solid notes, and put in time to study before tests, you will succeed in this class. Do not miss labs because make-up labs are long and tedious.

Dr. Wenzel really great. His awkward yet endearing humor makes class more interesting and you can tell her really cares about the material. Good guy and easy class. All really basic bio and only a few tests. Labs are easy too!
Professor Wenzel is a good lecturer. He definitely knows his stuff and gets to the point. The exams are difficult and sometimes worded strange but if you study well you'll be fine. Pretty chill guy

He's very easy to understand and a good lecturer.  For tests you only need to know the general process of how things work, not all the little specific details.   He uses tophat during class and you turn in a worksheet on some days, so if you skip you will lose some points.  Overall his class is great and he looks kind of like Ryan Gosling.

Dr. Wenzel was a great professor who made the class interesting and very laid back. There are pop quizzes, and every class you will turn something in for credit so you technically have to go to every class. The tests are easy as long as you study the learning objectives at the beginning of each power point.

Aaron is an amazing guy, being that his easygoing-ness makes the entire class feel comfortable a part of the conversation. He's very open about every individual's perception and ideas, which is refreshing as a young professor. All in all, he's a helpful, entertaining guy.

I don't know much about Aaron because I took the online class, but he responded to emails and questions immediately. You learn the terms, and you just have to remember what they mean. Can't get any easier than that.
if you want an easy A with this class don't get your hopes up. it was dreadful and complicatingly stupid in all honesty.it was awful experience don't take this online version. awful i tell you!

Aaron is easy going and a blast to have for a professor. He is funny and keeps the mood very light hearted in the class room. He is more than willing to aid any student in need of help and he is diligent when it to comes to ensuring that students understand the concepts.
Very good teacher,  willing to help the students.  Has passion for his students and his class...  A+
He doesn't really seem to know his stuff
Aaron is a great teacher. He is very helpful and tries to make Latin fun while making sure you understand the concepts. This is not an easy class but he will help you with every step!

Latin is HARD.  But Aaron is super helpful.  He is willing to do anything it takes to make you understand the material, even if it means sitting there and going over it with you or making an extra study sheet for you.  He's easy to understand and nice on the eyes.  If you are unlucky enough to take Latin, take it with him.

Aaron is simply the best if you want to learn Latin. This class is not easy and requires a good deal of work, but Aaron is more than willing to help you outside of class and will do whatever it takes to make concepts understandable. Aaron keeps class light and interesting with occasional digressions on Roman life and literature. A delightful class.
Aaron is absolutely hilarious in class and makes the class very easy to go to. It is really easy to get an A as long as you go to class.

Aaron is great. Exams are very long and difficult and you should plan on sticking around for awhile after class to finish them, but if you put in the effort you'll do fine. If you really want to learn Latin, Aaron is the go-to guy.

summary_comment: Professor Vaananen is highly passionate about Classic Greek Mythology and effectively conveys his enthusiasm in the classroom. While textbooks are not required, he recommends reading online summaries for deeper understanding. His assessments, including quizzes and the final exam, are straightforward, and he is lenient in grading papers.
summary_comment_short: Professor Vaananen is highly regarded for his passion in teaching Classic Greek Mythology. His classes are well-structured with straightforward quizzes and a final exam, and he is known to be lenient on paper grades.

Ratings.comment: Very passionate about Classic Greek Mythology. Books aren't necessary, just make sure to read online summaries. Quizzes and final exam are straightforward. Grades easy on papers.

summary_comment: Professor Palmore is highly regarded for his passion and knowledge in Classics, making his lectures engaging and accessible. Students appreciate his fair grading and willingness to help, often recommending that they seek his feedback on assignments. However, some find his teaching style subjective and his lectures can be lengthy, with less emphasis on deep analysis.
summary_comment_short: Professor Palmore is highly regarded for his deep knowledge and passion for Classics, making his lectures engaging and accessible. Students appreciate his fairness, willingness to help, and the flexibility in project deadlines and paper submissions, though some find his teaching style and class discussions somewhat one-sided.

Ratings.comment: Aaron is a great professor. He's super passionate about his subject! You decide what you want to do for each of 3 projects. You can turn in rough drafts of your paper early to get feedback before getting a final grade which is nice. Quizzes are usually once a week and easy if you read the material. As long as you care a little, you'll do fine.

Just come to class and you'll do just fine. There are a number of plays and books to be read, but I only really ever looked at the texts to find evidence for exams/papers (sorry Dr. Palmore). His lectures are very engaging + he's very accessible outside of the classroom; you'll be able to get him to look over your theses/papers before assessments.

He teaches the class based on his own personal definition of a myth. You'll reach out for help but all he will do is assert his opinion for everything so you have no choice but to nod along and agree with him. His lectures are long and any meanings you draw from a given work never have enough depth for him.

He really knows his stuff, and is genuinely passionate and cares about Classics. He is a very fair grader and is easy to talk to and willing to help you out if you show interest and effort in the class.

An amazing Classics teacher! He is extremely passionate about what he teaches and is a fair grader. I recommend that you email him your final draft and really read the comments he gives. If you take his comments into consideration and come to all of his classes you're grade will be fine! He's very willing to help and wants to see you succeed.

Took this class as a Gen Ed for Literature and it wasn't too bad. Dr. Palmore really tried to make class discussions interesting and you can tell he's very knowledgeable and passionate. As long as you put in a decent amount of effort, he's pretty lenient with grading.

I really enjoyed Professor Palmore's class! He really cares about his students understanding the classics. He is always willing to look over essays and help his students improve in his class. Overall I enjoyed his teaching style and the classical books that he taught. I would recommend this class to anyone who needs a Lit. Gen ED or just for fun!

summary_comment: Professor Jones is highly regarded for her engaging and interactive teaching style, making even potentially dull subjects interesting. She maintains a relaxed grading policy with minimal homework and a focus on participation, often assigning readings that encourage active learning through group discussions and translations. Students consistently praise her enthusiasm and willingness to help, describing her as both knowledgeable and approachable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jones is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style and ability to make complex subjects interesting. Students appreciate her supportive approach, frequent interaction, and willingness to help, though some note occasional repetition in discussion questions.

Ratings.comment: Great teacher. She keeps class interesting. There is class discussions but since you are in a group only one person has to speak. Only requires two papers and she is a fairly easy grader. Take her if you can!
Professor Molly-Jones is pretty awesome. She's one of the cutest geeky professors I've seen also. She loves her class, her students, and wouldn't consider taking a Classics course without her!

She was very excited about the class, but got a little repetitive with discussion questions every single day! Only grades were mini paper, midterm paper, final paper, and attendance. Little work for an easy A!

Very nice woman. Loves the subject material and teaching it to students. One of the best teachers I've ever had here. She is definately a little bit of a nerd, but she made classes interactive and educational. She was helpful and would go out of her way in order to help a student learn. She only expected effort and participation to get a good grade

Molly is awesome! She always has interesting stories to tell. The class is based entirely upon translating the Aeneid. Homework (translating passages) is assigned nightly but is not collected. Every day she makes people read aloud the previous night's passage. Easy A.
She's the best!
Loved her!! Her class was so much fun! she took something relatively boring like ancient medicine and made it super interesting. Attendance was mandatory, but trust me you'll want to come!
Very knowledgeable, she knows what she is talking about.

summary_comment: Professor Maiullo is highly regarded for his engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, particularly in courses on Ovid's "Metamorphoses." He creates a fun and dynamic classroom environment, often adjusting the schedule to meet student needs and ensuring that attendance is mandatory. His teaching approach is flexible and supportive, leading to consistently positive evaluations and recommendations from students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Maiullo is highly regarded for his engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, particularly in courses on Ovid, where he encourages thorough discussion of both English and Latin texts. His classes are described as fun and interesting, with many students praising his flexibility, fairness, and dedication to helping students learn.

Ratings.comment: He is fun and is enthusiastic about Ovid.  He had us read the whole Metamorphoses in English in addition to reading excerpts in Latin, and we discussed the English thoroughly.  Never buy a textbook which is in the public domain.  "Metamorphoses" is available online in its entirety.
My favorite teacher so far @OSU, and I've had some great ones. So personable. Slightly hard to focus with such a kickin' accent.

If you show up, do light homework and pay attention in class this is an easy A. Fun teacher. Early class, but it was worth it. Adjusts the class schedule to meet the needs of students. Really good prof and therefore good class.

Steve is highly recommended. Class is fun. He is flexible with the schedule (based on how students are doing), and is an extremely fair grader. Attendance is mandatory, though!! He is just really laid back, flexible and invested in helping students learn. Definitely one of the top teachers I've had at OSU.

Steve is an amazing teacher and he makes Latin fun (no really) for everyone. Whether you're just taking it to fill your foreign language requirement or you're a classics major, Steve will keep you learning and amused. He also wears a lot of chalk.

He is easily one of my most favorite professors I have had at Ohio State and even throughout my life. Makes class very fun and interesting and gives VERY fair grades. Just show interest and try and its almost a guaranteed A. I have had him for 101, 2, and 4 and really missed him in 103. I strongly reccomend Steve.
Steve was an awesome teacher, even 5 years ago.. Specially when he read poems!! You can learn a lot from him if you go to class and ask for help when you need it. He's also very interesting...

One of the greatest people I've ever met. Helped me with anything I didn't understand and made fun of the class for stupid quirks and the class did the same to him. Very few classes are good enough to show up everyday at 830am but this was one of them. As long as you try in his class, you'll do fine, namely you'll get an A.
Steve is hilarious and fun to listen to. you will definately won't be falling asleep in this reading class. THe way he presents the material is interesting too!
No Comments
Agree! He/'s great! I really learned a lot from the J-Man!

He's a great teacher (especially for a grad student).  He knows what it takes to learn Latin and makes sure you do too.  He's fun without straying too far off topic (most of the time :) ).  On top of all that, he's also a very fair grader and a really nice guy.  Highly recommended.
Steve is very involved with his students and clearly enjoys teaching.  He also has a wicked sexy Boston accent.  ;-)

summary_comment: Professor Moodie is highly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about her subject matter, effectively conveying her expertise in Latin and Roman civilization. However, her lectures can be challenging for students who lack prior knowledge, with some finding the workload and memorization requirements overwhelming. Despite these challenges, many students appreciate her engaging personality and teaching style.
summary_comment_short: Professor Moodie is highly knowledgeable and enthusiastic, effectively conveying complex material in a lively manner. However, the course demands significant time and effort, particularly for memorization, which can be challenging for students with heavy workloads or less prior knowledge.

Ratings.comment: I couldn't understand a thing she talked about. When I looked at the slides, some of the facts were wrong. Never went to a single lecture. My recitation teacher was amazing though. Still got a B without ever attending though.

I had no prior knowledge of Roman Civilization before this class & still got an A-. The names of people are hard to learn, reading the assignments helps. Quizzes are ok, but you MUST study! Reading load is slightly heavy. She's a good teacher, very knowledgeable, & gives at least somewhat of a review before every quiz, midterm & final.

Don't take this class if you want to have a life. She is a good instructor, but the workload and amount of time it takes to memorize everything she wants you to know is ridiculous. If you do anything outside of taking classes, this one is not worth your time.
Wonderful professor!  Great enthusiasm, great knowledge of Latin, infectious cheer - an all around excellent combination of a splendid professor and a splendid person.
Good teacher, knows her stuff.  Goofy, funny, pleasant.

summary_comment: Professor Pavlick is highly knowledgeable and passionate about archaeology, making her classes engaging and informative. She expects students to be equally dedicated, with a heavy emphasis on detailed lecture slides that are crucial for exams. Students find her approach effective for learning, though they note the need for significant study effort to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pavlick is highly knowledgeable and passionate about archaeology, making her classes engaging but demanding a significant amount of preparation and study. She expects thorough understanding and retention of detailed information presented in her lectures and slides.

Ratings.comment: This professor loves what she does and if you attend lectures and pay attention you will get a good grade.  You will do a good bit of reading in this course however the material is fantastic.  Lots of information in the lecture slides as well that you will be tested on.
She loves her field and is incredibly knowledgeable and that makes the class very enjoyable

Professor Pavlick is helpful and very knowledgeable about archaeology. However, she expects her students to be experts as well. She's very passionate about the topic, so she includes a ton of information in her slides. It's very detailed and specific and you are expected to recall ALL of it on the midterms. Be prepared to study hard for this GE

summary_comment: Professor Hackworth is highly regarded for his engaging lecturing style and deep knowledge, making even challenging subjects like Classical Literature interesting and compelling. His enthusiasm and willingness to discuss ideas make his classes interactive and enjoyable, though exams can be demanding. Students appreciate his thorough coverage and the use of daily quizzes for consistent feedback.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hackworth is an exceptionally engaging lecturer who brings enthusiasm and interest to his subjects, making even challenging topics enjoyable. His knowledge and passion for the material are evident, and he encourages active participation and discussion, though exams can be demanding.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hackworth really is a great lecturer. Just had him for Classical Literature. This is not a subject that interests me at all but he is so enthusiastic and makes his lectures so interesting that I never missed a class. Definitely would try to take another class with him.

Hackworth is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. He makes his classes very interesting and he's always willing to talk things through and discuss ideas. Highly recommend. For his classes (and to get a good grade) you have to read the books, study, and be involved.
Easily the best orator, most concise notes, and the most interactive. Even though the class was at 8am.

Good instructor, although there were some gaps in his coverage of certain topics.  Exams were difficult, but daily quizzes keep them from damaging the grade too much and give you steady feedback on what areas you need to concentrate on.
Great TA. Had him for Latin 101-103. Very helpful and can get carried away with history, which makes class go by faster. Gives quizzes every day, but they are very easy and just boost your grade.

TA for Classics 222. Not bad. Is helpful if you ask questions. Is a historian at heart, and so will get carried away with dates and figures therefore every now and then it helps to reel him in...and ask lotsa questions. Good experience though! (had recitations with him)

summary_comment: Professor Jean offers a rigorous course with extensive reading assignments and a focus on detailed historical knowledge spanning 50 specific years and key figures. The exams are precise and comprehensive, covering these specifics with no room for error. Despite the challenging workload, there are minor opportunities for extra credit.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jean offers a rigorous course with extensive reading assignments and comprehensive tests focusing on specific historical years and figures. The course structure includes only three major tests but provides opportunities for extra credit.

Ratings.comment: Heavy course work. Long reading assignments. Have to know about 50 specific years and people for tests, which also have very specific questions. There's only 3 tests as well. There are some opportunities for extra points, though.

summary_comment: Professor Jendza is highly regarded for making mythology engaging and enjoyable through humor and interactive lectures. Students appreciate his enthusiasm for the subject and find his classes fun despite the substantial reading load. The course structure includes various assignments and exams, but students generally find the material manageable with consistent effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jendza is known for making mythology engaging and enjoyable through humor and interactive lectures, though the course requires significant reading and preparation. His classes are praised for their fun and dynamic nature, despite the demanding workload, and students find his lectures and PowerPoints to be comprehensive guides for success.

Ratings.comment: Craig was one of the funniest professors I've ever had.  He made learning mythology really fun.  We had to read a chapter of the book for every class.  Grade consists of three assignments, quizzes, group project, midterm, final paper, and final exam.  Show up to class, take notes, do the readings, and you'll do great.

Great guy and really into the subject he is teaching. I would definitely recommend this class. Took this course to get a gen ed credit but ended up being really interesting. His lectures are exciting and everything you need to know is basically in his PWPT slides, along with a few things from readings and assignments. Study a ton for the exams!
Turned a boring subject into something enjoyable. He would include jokes in his lectures, which made the subject bearable

First off, Craig really is hilarious. I was not excited to be taking Classics (I only took it because it fulfilled 2 GE requirements) and he made lecture much more interesting than I had expected. That being said, there is a lot of reading. Also, there is only one midterm before the final, so each of two exams have a lot of information on them.

Definitely enjoys the subject matter. Always joking around and having a good time. Some of the assignments take a bit of creativity, which was hard, but he grades pretty easily. Lots of readings from the book, but he works through them in class if you haven't read them
Craig is really cool and likes what he's talking about. There's a lot of reading and a few assignments that require some thought, but it's a great class. Also he is nice to look at.

Dr. Jendza is a very affable guy and his class is actually kind of fun. There is a lot of reading to do outside of class but he breaks it down for you in class so it makes it kind of manageable. The essays are also kind of fun to write as well.
Great professor! Highly interested in his subject and highly knowledgeable. Reading is kind of intense but it's super easy. Just study his powerpoints and what he talks about in class.
Mr. Jendza is an excellent teacher and very helpful!

Craig is the most patient teacher in the entire world. He guides you through one of the most difficult subjects any student will ever take and gives as much help as you need. He's a soft grader and really understands how difficult the subject matter is. He is an excellent teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Marshall is highly regarded for her supportive approach, especially for students fulfilling language requirements, who find her very helpful in preparing for in-class readings and offering assistance through office hours and emails. However, her class demands significant dedication, particularly for those without prior knowledge of Ancient Greece, as it involves extensive reading and high expectations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Marshall is highly regarded for her supportive approach and thorough preparation of students, offering extensive resources and encouragement to ensure success. However, her class demands significant commitment and prior knowledge of the subject matter, making it challenging for those without a strong background in Ancient Greek studies.

Ratings.comment: She is a great professor. For a student who needs the class for a language requirement she is very supportive. She has you read the passage ahead of time to prepare for in class readings. She also works with students in office hours and by email. By showing that you are willing to work and want to succeed you will not fail! I would have her again.

If you don't have any genuine interest or background knowledge on anything related to Ancient Greece, I would not take this class. It is very heavy reading and a lot of material. There are quizzes at the beginning of each class period to take attendance but Dr. Marshall gives you the questions previously, so if you do the reading you'll be fine.

Absolutely do not take this class unless you want to major or minor is classics, that is how she treats this course.  She expects everyone to behave like Greek scholars.  It is awful!  I only took this class to get a Global requirement, and I seriously regret it every time I am in class or doing any work for the class.

summary_comment: Professor Wright is known for his clear and consistent teaching style, making expectations and requirements very clear. While his classes involve a significant amount of reading, which can be dry, students find his tests and quizzes manageable with effort. He is generally supportive and responsive to emails, though he occasionally loses focus during discussions, which can be frustrating if the readings haven't been adequately prepared.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wright is known for his clear and consistent teaching style, providing students with a thorough understanding of expectations and material. He assigns a significant amount of reading, though some find it dry, and offers helpful feedback on papers and is responsive via email.

Ratings.comment: Quite a few papers, but always gives concise prompts and will push papers back if he hasn't given you feedback for the last one yet. Sometimes gets really angry when he randomly decides to have class discussions on a reading, but no one has read it. Try to skim all the readings or have a good summary of them all

Tests and quizzes are easy. He gives you all the information. It's impossible to fail as long as you are trying. He is super helpful if you ever email him. Tends to get off topic, but he's very interesting.
Because he was my professor for recitation, the it was mandatory. He is a nice guy, honestly. Fun guy, fun class, fun semester.

Mark is an incredible teacher. His Latin classes present the information in a consistent and understandable manner. There is no question what is expected of you, and if you put in the necessary effort, you will succeed. He realizes that Latin is an extremely hard subject; he counters this by his clarity. I would recommend this teacher to anyone!
good prof
A lot of reading to do and the reading is very dry. Quizes aren't too difficult if all the reading is understood.

summary_comment: Professor Dowlingsoka is known for his dedication to his class, treating students almost like graduate students and assigning substantial paper work. However, his teaching style lacks modern aids like PowerPoint presentations and his lectures are often incomplete by mid-semester. Attendance is not strictly required, and students can achieve high grades with minimal class participation, focusing instead on completing papers and preparing for exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dowlingsoka is known for his dedication to the class, treating students almost like graduate students and assigning substantial paper work. However, his teaching style, which includes lengthy lectures without PowerPoint support and infrequent classes, makes the learning experience less engaging and more dependent on independent study.

Ratings.comment: Joel only does the recitation, so you don't see hum much, but, overall, he seems to be a normal TA. Don't expect anything out of the ordinary.

I find it admirable that he cares so much about his class and wants to treat us like grad students. I do not appreciate, however, having to write 8-10 page papers and endure lectures without powerpoints (he just stops half way through the semester). You will not get an A in this class unless you work your ass off (you know like in a major course).

You honestly dont have to show up for a single class. As long as you complete the papers, and study for midterm and final you'll get a B or A. I advise not going to class... I have been going since the beginning of the semester and I don't get anything out of them.

summary_comment: Professor Schaefers is an excellent teacher known for her enthusiasm and deep knowledge of Greek and Roman mythology. She primarily assesses students through weekly quizzes and three papers, which she grades fairly easily if students keep up with reading and note-taking. Her lectures can be fast-paced but are highly accessible.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schaefers is an excellent teacher known for her enthusiasm and deep knowledge of Greek and Roman mythology. Her classes are generally easy to follow, with weekly quizzes and three papers being the primary assessments, which she grades fairly leniently.

Ratings.comment: Good teacher. Weekly quizzes and 3 papers were only grades. she didnt grade very hard. would definitely recommend taking her with this class if you are looking for a GEC

Incredibly enthusiastic and knowledgeable. Papers/quizzes are generally very easy as long as you read and/or take good notes. She is always willing to answer questions and is a wealth of knowledge about Greek and Roman mythology. Lectures are fast-paced sometimes but very easy to follow. Great class! Fantastic teacher! Highly recommend!

summary_comment: Professor Teitel-Paule is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging personality. Students appreciate his humor and ability to make the material accessible, finding his classes and recitations both enjoyable and informative. His TAs are praised for their clarity, willingness to help, and ability to create a positive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Teitel-Paule is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making the class enjoyable and accessible for students who prepare the required readings. His TAs are praised for their clarity, helpfulness, and ability to create a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: He is sarcastic, but funny! He appreciates students who do the readings, and he makes the class basically effortless for them.

Max is the best TA i have had so far in my almost 4 years at OSU. He keeps the atmosphere light and has no problem giving you very specific tips on what to expect on the quizzes. If you show an interest and come to recitation he will be glad to help you. overall great guy and great TA
He's an awesome ta, really funny and really smart.
Awesome TA for the class. He explained everything very clearly and was willing to take any questions you had.  Great TA!

Maxwell TP is an awesome TA. He's really funny, but gets to the point. He understands no one cares about Classics and that it was a GEC. He's really cool. Take him if you have a choice, you won't regret it.

summary_comment: Professor McCloskey offers an easily manageable online course with clear expectations and timely support. Students find his approach straightforward and his assessments non-cumulative, making preparation more focused. Overall, his teaching quality is highly regarded for its clarity and effectiveness.
summary_comment_short: Professor McCloskey offers an effective and straightforward online course, clearly communicating his expectations and providing timely support. His exams are not cumulative, and with adequate preparation, students find the class manageable and rewarding.

Ratings.comment: His class is online, but very easy to do.  He is clean cut about what he wants and expects of you. He helps if needed within the next day and you have no trouble if you study for the midterm and final (not cumulative).

summary_comment: Professor Hanson is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, described as both hilarious and extremely helpful. Students praise his ability to make the General Education Course (GEC) experience outstandingly enjoyable and informative. His class is considered top-notch, and many wish they could take all their courses with him.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hanson is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, described as both hilarious and extremely helpful. Students unanimously praise his ability to enhance the General Education Course (GEC) experience, making him a top choice for any class.

Ratings.comment: J Hans is awesome!! Best GEC experience ever. He is hillarious. and very very helpful with anything you need. Class Act. If i was a classics major id want him for anything! Take him if possible!

summary_comment: No comments available
summary_comment_short: No comments available

summary_comment: Professor Roller's teaching in the Plutarch class was widely perceived as monotonous and lacking in insight, with a conservative methodology that focused heavily on his personal theories. Students found the class unengaging and the final project—a 10-page paper—particularly burdensome, leading many to withdraw early.
summary_comment_short: Professor Roller's teaching methodology in the Plutarch class was described as extremely conservative and uninsightful, leading to a dull and unengaging learning experience. Students found his focus on his own historical theories monotonous and ultimately withdrew due to an unsatisfactory final assignment format.

Ratings.comment: His class on Plutarch was amazingly dull and uninspiring -- and I love ancient Greek!  His methodology was extremely conservative and uninsightful, and he rambled on and on about his own pet historical theories ad nauseum.  The final was a 10 page paper, and I realized that I couldn't write a paper for that man, so I withdrew after four weeks.

summary_comment: Professor Poochigian is highly regarded for his engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, making the classes both enjoyable and informative. Students find him approachable and supportive, particularly in offering help with assignments and final papers. While some note that he occasionally spoils story endings, the overall consensus is that he is a very understanding, helpful, and entertaining professor who significantly enhances the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Poochigian is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining lectures, making the class enjoyable and easy to follow with thorough readings. Students praise his enthusiasm, knowledge, and willingness to help, particularly with assignments and exams.

Ratings.comment: This was one of the most fun classes I've ever taken. Dr. Poochigian is super fun to listen to during lecture.
Great professor! Very enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the subject.  Also approachable and willing to help his students.

He is one of the most enthusiastic professors I have ever had. Make sure to read buy all of the books and to actually do the reading, it makes the class so much easier. He did like to spoil the endings of all of the stories before we read them though which was kind of annoying. He is willing to help- especially when it comes to the final paper.

Prof. Poochigian was amazing! He was very helpful and made the classes entertaining. As long as you do the readings and pay attention in class, you should have NO problems. I would definitely recommend his class, as he was one of the most understanding, helpful, and entertaining professors I have had thus far!

Prof. Poochigian is an enthusiastic and caring professor, I loved him! Keep up on readings and take good class notes and you'll be fine on exams. He loves if you e-mail him questions/drafts of essays. He is very understanding!
Aaron was the best. He is an awesome lecturer and amazingly smart. He provides a great study guide for the Exam and is very approachable! Just be sure to keep up on the reading

summary_comment: Professor McCullough is known for her engaging and knowledgeable approach, particularly among freshmen and non-majors, though her teaching style can be challenging. Students find her lectures interesting and her exams straightforward, especially the midterms, but note that quizzes are very difficult and require intense reading. Her grading can be strict, particularly for essays, and attendance is mandatory. Some students appreciate her passion for the subject, while others find her lectures repetitive and her approach to teaching Latin less effective.
summary_comment_short: Professor McCullough's teaching quality is mixed; while some students find her lectures engaging, interesting, and humorous, others criticize the course structure, finding it heavily reliant on essays and quizzes that are perceived as difficult. Her knowledge and enthusiasm for the subject matter are generally acknowledged, though some students feel the class dynamics can become strained.

Ratings.comment: She's not a bad person or professor, the problem is with the way the course it laid out. Your grade is basically two essays and the final, that's it, and she's a bit picky with the essays. Reading is ESSENTIAL to the course, but lecture is just rehashing the text so you don't really have to attend.
She's a hard grader on the papers but everything was really interesting and she basically gives you the answers in class to the final exam.

Class is interesting and the teacher is great. The quizzes however are VERY hard. You have to read very intensely because the quiz questions will ask for a specific detail on one line. Other than the 5 point weekly quizzes, the class is interesting. THE QUIZZES ARE HARD.

Really funny and interesting, and she's writing a book on what she's teaching for 508. Homework is reading and two papers. Midterms are straight off the study guide and pretty easy and conceptual. Definitely take her. For reference, I'm a freshman science major who just took the class because it was a GEC fitting with my schedule.

Dr. McCullough was such an amazing professor. It was fun to have a female teacher instruct a Sports & Spectacles class. She is very knowledgeable and is fun to talk to even outside class. She's also for engaging & tries her best to keep you interested as well.

she absolutely loves ancient rome and knows so much about it and is very clear. attendence is mandatory and she doesnt mess around, but once you get used to her straight to business style, she actually is pretty funny. DO THE READINGS!!!

She's big on gender theory and books in English, extremely weak on philology. Class dynamic got worse and worse, with the teacher versus the class. I would tell my enemies to take her class, but not my friends.

Prose Comp. She sat at the front reading the textbook out verbatim, which we could more easily have read at home ourselves. Then she put us in groups to make sentences, but was unable to give any solid advice as to their correctness. Hasn't got a firm grasp on the Latin language or its mechanics. I learned more from my condisciples than from her.

summary_comment: Professor Rader was highly regarded for his thorough teaching approach, ensuring students fully understood the material through extensive book reviews. He offered a mix of quizzes, papers, and minimal exams, making the course accessible yet challenging for those who engaged regularly. Despite some criticisms regarding his language and emphasis on participation, many students found his lectures engaging and appreciated his humor and helpfulness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rader was highly regarded for his thorough teaching methods, ensuring all students understood the material through extensive review sessions, and assigning only weekly quizzes and three papers. Despite some mixed feedback regarding his cussing and emphasis on participation, he was generally praised for making lectures engaging and memorable.

Ratings.comment: Was a really great professor. Went over the books until everyone understood. And only had weekly quizzes and 3 papers. Unfortunately, he took at job at USC and is no longer at Ohio State. Too bad, because he was one of the best.
YUMMY!! super hot and a great prof...his lectures were energetic and fun..the best class ever :)
Professor was very easy. He even admitted it was too easy. He is no longer registered on the Greek and Latin Dept. He might have left for another full-time job.

Rader was a mixture of good and bad. Good: super hot, pretty laid back, funny and very intelligent. He actually made lectures interesting. Bad: cusses WAY too much, which made him seem really unprofessional and just plain wasn't necessary. He also put way too much emphasis on participation, and made us read these horrid incomprehensible articles.
One of the best professors I've ever had. Very funny, and he's very helpful. No exams just 10 point quizzes and a 5 page paper on each book.

Funny guy. No class on fridays, just a quiz on Carmen. Lots of reading that you must keep up with it. You won't be able to get all the points on the quizzes by looking up all the answers. Exams are fairly easy if you read and go to lecture. STUDY THE CARMEN QUIZZES. They will show up word for word on the exams. Overall, not difficult

No lie, I was a bit intimated from the workload the sylbus projected for me, However, you take his quizzes and they're cake. All of a sudden, you don't need to do the readings anymore. If you want that absolute 'A' be very attentive and go to all classes, but if your looking for an easy 'B' take this class and go to half of them. Very Easy.

Ric was a good professor for Classics. I was a little worried about my literature, but this class was pretty straightforward. Weekly quizzes were easy...45% of your grade. Midterm and final were verbatim questions from quizzes. Do the readings and attend the weekly recitation, and you'll do great. Good experience, glad to have lit credit done!

There is a lot of reading but its really interesting. The lecture is huge but you'll want to go to it everyday since ric is very good looking ( like a david beckham lookalike) Quizzes are simple and midterm and final are just the questions from the quizes

An easy class with little effort put into it. Skim the readings & attend lecture & recitation & you will have no problem. He makes class enjoyable to the point that I looked forward to going to lecture. Coming into the class with no knowledge about that subject matter what-so-ever, I had no problem getting an A. And it helped that he was gorgeous!

Ric is the hottest guy I have ever seen in person! Besides that obvious reason to take the class, it is extremely easy, you don't even have to do the readings, he tells you everything you need to know for the tests and quizzes. The class is so laidback and entertaining I don't even mind going and the class is taught exactly how a GEC should be.

this is easily the most enjoyable class i have taken at OSu in my almost four years. Rader keeps the text interesting and actually makes lecture really enjoyable. i actually look forward to this class and i would highly recommend it to anyone who wants an A while being entertained.
Prof Rader is SMOKIN HOT,,, hes the only reason why i go to lectures.... cute sweet funny and smart... and his class is probably the easiest ive taken in all four years here at osu.... i recommend

extremely entertaining! he makes the topic interesting by interpreting the subject matter in a way that students understand - so you want to learn. plus he is incredibly good looking making you want to go to class

Not a fan.  He uses words he thinks sound smart, but if you know what they are you realize it's all a show.  He leads boring class discussions, allows dull know-it-alls to dominate them, and doesn't have a very professional demeanor.

Ric is HOT, his lectures are really interesting and in-depth, and the material itself is very interesting. The text is referenced a lot, and it helps if you read it, but you get most of the information either in lecture or in recitation. Tests are easy and fairly up front. Easy A if you put in at least a little effort

Very interesting lectures based on Greek Mythology.This course is incredibly easy.Do not buy the course materials,simply choose to A. go to class and pay attention or B.read the cliffnotes. Either way you must attend the recitation as it is part of your grade.Rader is an intellectual and funny man that sometimes talks about Nelly Furtado too much.

Easiest class I've ever taken. Go to lecture and recitation (if you have a good TA like Sam Flores), read the Spark/Cliff Notes, and you'll likely get an A if you have a decent memory. It's kinda weird having a frat boy (Ric) teach the class... he's real into himself. Lectures could be condensed to 20 minutes, but whatever the class is super easy.

Very easy class. If you know anything about Greek Mythology you will easily get an A. The prof is a hottie and very easy to listen to, minus the amount of obscenities he uses. All in all easy class and  good prof
I never thought I'd have an interest in boys until I met Ric Rader.
Easy, engaging, and fun professor. Class is an easy A and fulfills two GECs. Knowledgeable on subject, workload isn't difficult at all. And he's a cutie!

This class was a lot of fun, not to mention he is VERY hot and easy to look at. I always went to class just to look at him, and it helped me learn...lol..Attendance is not mandatory, but if you have questions over the material it really helps becasue the power points are not online. It is easy over all and I learned a lot.

Took Classics 101 for my minor, was almost the exact same class as 222, which i had already taken, so i didn't need to go to lecture...BUT it was worth getting up to go because Ric is GORGEOUS!  And his dance moves are awesome.

His class is an EASY A. You don't need to waste your money on buying a book until the end of the quater for your final Exam because he covers the book on his powerpoint. Cusses a lot. He is Pretty funny.
very nice looking.  its too bad the course was online because i would have liked to see alot more of him

Lectures are all you need to go to.  You dont need to read all of the books cuz he summarizes them all really well with powerpoint.  Awesome class, very fun! Even got to watch some Chappelle's show at the end of the quarter
Good teacher, pretty gorgeous!

dancing goats unite!  Ric has a wonderful personality and sense of humor-  not to mention he's an amazing scholar and classicist (to be one, must first be a good HUMAN, which he is... naturally, in the *nature* sense, not just the *of course* sense.)
Make sure to ask him about the dancing goats.  ;)
